description:
/* Must register to attend: https://www.ibm.com/events/swgeer/swgeer06.nsf/signin?openform&seminar=kwokder8xmtgr&lang=en*/

Join IBM Big Data Developers for an afternoon Hack-a-thon on September 13, 2012 in Silicon Valley! Please read below for the event details and how you can register today!

If you want to work with "big data" without writing code or scripts, you'll want to look into BigSheets. BigSheets is a spreadsheet-style tool for business analysts provided with IBM® InfoSphere® BigInsights, a platform based on the open source Apache Hadoop project. This event teaches you the basics of using BigSheets to analyze social media and structured data collected through sample applications provided with BigInsights. You'll learn how to model this data in BigSheets, manipulate this data using built-in macros and functions, create charts to visualize your work, and export the results of your analysis in one of several popular output formats.

Selecting the option to attend within this meet-up does not confirm your registration. We only have 50 seats available, therefore if you would like to attend please register at the following link!!!

https://www.ibm.com/events/swgeer/swgeer06.nsf/signin?openform&seminar=kwokder8xmtgr&lang=en

We will confirm you within 48 hours once we have registration.

We look forward to having you join us for a great event.
name: IBM Big Data Developer Hack-A-Thon

description:
Join IBM Big Data Developers for an afternoon Hack-a-thon on October 4, 2012 in the Silicon Valley! This month, we will explore IBM Text Analytics! Please read below for the event details and how you can register today!

/* Must register to attend: https://www-950.ibm.com/events/swgeer/swgeer06.nsf/signin?openform&seminar=kwokder8yfjcs&lang=en

*/

IBM Text Analytics is a high performance, highly scalable information extraction engine that can be applied to Big Data at rest and Big Data in motion. It includes a library of pre-built extractors, a SQL like language for coding custom extractors and a sophisticated set of tools. This Hack-a-thon will introduce you to AQL - Annotation Query Language – the language used to apply text analytics to extract information from unstructured documents. Using Eclipse based tools you will analyze document content about IBM’s Watson technology from a variety of social media such as blogs, forums and Twitter. You will then develop and test AQL code to extract information from these documents for further analysis.

Selecting the option to attend within this meet-up does not confirm your registration. We only have 50 seats available, therefore if you would like to attend please register at the following link!!!

https://www-950.ibm.com/events/swgeer/swgeer06.nsf/signin?openform&seminar=kwokder8yfjcs&lang=en

We will confirm you within 48 hours once we have registration.

We look forward to having you join us for a great event.
name: Big Data Hack-A-Thon: Text Analytics

description:
The topic for December's Big Data Hackathon will be real time analytics with IBM's InfoSphere Streams. Pre-register early to save your seat! More info to come.

Register here: https://www-950.ibm.com/events/swgeer/swgeer06.nsf/signin?openform&seminar=kwokder8yg27t&lang=en href="https://www-950.ibm.com/events/swgeer/swgeer06.nsf/signin?openform&seminar=kwokder8yfw3n&lang=en">

1:00pm-1:30pm: Networking (Snacks & Beverages provided)

1:30-2:15pm: Introduction to Real-time analytics & stream computing

2:15-2:30pm: Hands on Lab prep & Development Environment setup

2:30-5:30pm: Hack away

As the volume and variety of information contextually relevant to business grow at an exponential rate, Organizations are looking for new means to react quickly and accurately to please their customers and to gain competitive advantage. Existing approaches too often either arrive at the wrong decisions based on insufficient subsets of data, or they arrive at the correct decisions but too late to be of any usefulness.

With InfoSphere Streams, you can react to events and trends correctly and immediately while it's still possible to improve business outcomes. Government, Telecommunications, Healthcare, Energy and Utilities, Finance, Manufacturing, or any industry will benefit whenever there is a requirement for immediate and accurate analysis and decisions based on what is happening right now.

This meetup will:· Provide a common understanding of Stream Computing· Provide a brief overview of the InfoSphere Streams Architecture· Introduce the InfoSphere Streams Runtime Environment· Introduce InfoSphere Streams Studio· Introduce the SPL programming language· Introduce the Streams Mining Toolkit and integration with Data Mining Tools

Get a head start on this meetup by reviewing our redbook on Streams: http://www.redbooks.ibm.com/redpieces/abstracts/sg248108.html?Open
name: Big Data Hackathon: Real Time Analytics w/ InfoSphere Streams

description:
// Only way to guarantee seat is to register here: www.ibm.com/events/bigdatadevdayfostercity2013

Anjul Bhambhri, Vice President, IBM Big Data, will host a full day Developer Day at the IBM Silicon Valley Innovation Center on Friday, March 1st.

The day will include interactive discussions, live demonstrations and hands-on labs that address the full spectrum of big data business challenges.

A similar event was held last year and reached full capacity (75+).

Breakfast, lunch and afternoon snacks will be provided!

Full Agenda:

8:00 AM - 9:00 AM Breakfast & Registration

9:00 AM - 9:45 AM Welcome & Keynote “Boosting Your Big Data IQ with IBM’s Big Data Platform”

9:45 AM - 10:30 AM Using Big Data to Enhance the 360º Customer View (Demo)

Discovering and Exploring All your Data Sources Analyzing Data-at-Rest & Data-in-Motion Enriching Existing Customer Data for New Insights 10:30 AM - 10:45 AM Break

10:45 PM - 12:15 PM Product Innovation Deep Dives

Enterprise-grade Hadoop Analytics Stream Computing & Real-time Analytics Data Discovery & Exploration 12:30 PM - 1:00 PM Lunch

1:00 PM - 5:30 PM Big Data Hackathon & Hands on Lab

Hackathon Details:

Unlocking Big Data with InfoSphere Data Explorer

This IBM InfoSphere Data Explorer lab introduces general concept of what Data Explorer is, how powerful the search engine is, how IBM InfoSphere Data Explorer can help unlock Big Data. In this lab, you will perform basic tasks in Data Explorer to configure, categorize and search through from websites, databases and files.

Analyzing Data in Motion with InfoSphere Streams

IBM InfoSphere Streams enables continuous and fast analysis of massive volumes of moving data to help improve the speed of business insight and decision-making. InfoSphere Streams provides an execution platform and services for user-developed applications that ingest, filter, analyze, and correlate the information in data streams.

Analyzing Data at Rest with InfoSphere BigInsights

In this hands-on lab, you will see how IBM InfoSphere BigInsights, an analytics platform based on Hadoop, can help you quickly get your big data use cases up and running. You’ll learn how social media data, log data and other data sets can be analyzed at scale for valuable insights about your customers.

The event is close to being sold out. Please remember to register!

IBM Big SQL is new and exciting technology that extends the power of SQL to the world of Apache Hadoop data repositories (HDFS and HBase).

1:00pm-1:30pm: Networking

1:30-2:15pm: Introduction to IBM Big SQL

2:15-2:30pm: Hands on Lab prep & Development Environment setup

2:30-5:30pm: Hack away

Snacks & Beverages provided.

More Details:

Attendees get access to a Hadoop cluster on the IBM IM Demo Cloud. This Hadoop cluster is fully configured with both HDFS and HBase and has sample data loaded and available for queries. Participants will be able to download Big SQL JDBC and ODBC drivers and use these drivers with their favorite applications to explore and query data in the Hadoop cluster. Participants will also be able to use command line tools like JSqsh to submit their queries.

By leveraging our cloud environment, there is no need to obtain hardware, install and patch operating systems, install the Hadoop code or manage the Hadoop cluster.

Take our poll to help us determine future topics: http://www.meetup.com/BigDataDevelopers/polls/

description:
** Seating is limited, please only RSVP 'Yes' if you do plan to attend **

Join us on Thursday, May 2nd for our next Big Data Developer Meetup!

This meetup will focus on Real-Time Location Based Analytics and will include a presentation, demo, hands-on session (bring your laptop), and pizza! Doors open at 5:30pm for registration and networking, while the program starts at 6:30pm.

With smart phones and fully instrumented cars, the amount of data we can collect from moving objects is growing at staggering rates. In a few years, the automotive industry will be the largest data producer of data after utilities -- bigger than health care. And with this Big Data volume comes Big Data challenges. The opportunity for applying all this data in real-time to problems in transportation, congestion management, emergency response, microweather prediction, supply chain management, and so on is tremendous. But this requires a real-time analytics platform that can integrate GPS locations, telematics messages and sensor readings, video, and other kinds of information--and scale up to any level.

Join us to learn about how IBM InfoSphere Streams is addressing this Big Data challenge. The event will kick off with a presentation and will be followed by a live demo. Bring your laptop, because you'll then have an opportunity to get hands on with InfoSphere Streams and apply this exciting new technology yourself!

Pizza & beverages will be provided!

Agenda

5:30pm: Registration & Networking & Pizza!

6:30pm: Presentation

7:15pm: Break

7:30pm: Demo

8:15pm: Hands On with Real-time Analytics

Use this link: http://bigdatauniversity.com/courses/course/view.php?id=513Enrollment key: meet123up

You will need VMware Player or VMware Fusion to run the VMware image.

Join us on June 28, 2013 to participate in an exclusive Big Data Developer Day hosted by Anjul Bhambhri, IBM Vice President, Big Data, along with the IBM Big Data Development team. Open source Apache Hadoop is a great framework for distributed processing of large data sets. But there’s a difference between "playing" with big data versus solving real problems. The reality is that Hadoop alone is not enough. Experience IBM’s enterprise-class Hadoop product, InfoSphere BigInsights, which enhances open source Hadoop with required enterprise capabilities including: analytics, visualization, security, enterprise integration, developer/admin tools, and more. The morning session will include interactive discussions and live demonstrations of IBM's latest big data innovations; and, in the afternoon, get hands-on with InfoSphere BigInsights Quick Start with guidance from development experts. This is a unique opportunity to develop skills and learn about exciting technologies and techniques that you can immediately take back to your organization.

This event is FREE. Breakfast, Lunch and snacks will be provided.

description:
Discussion/presentation of Hive and BigSQL.

Big SQL doesn't turn Hadoop into one big distributed relational database. If you're curious about what Big SQL can do, we'll explore the basics here, try to clear up some common misconceptions, and answer many of the questions that relational DBMS users often have about this new technology.

We'll also discuss Hive - the "SQL-like" capability that is part of Hadoop.
name: Topic: SQL Access to HDFS Data

description:
Join us on Tuesday, July 30th at 5:30pm in Foster City!

Rapidly gaining in popularity, maturity and footprint is the HBase NoSQL datastore. Apache HBase is known as the Hadoop Database and is included in IBM's InfoSphere BigInsights product. HBase is typically deployed on clusters of Linux x86 servers running on top of Apache Hadoop's HDFS. HBase clusters scale seamlessly as new nodes are added to the system. Cost is dramatically reduced,and the big data challenges often found in Relational Database Management Systems (RDBMs) are solved with HBase (e.g. sharding is automatic and sparse data records supported). Whereas existing RDBMSs can manage terabytes of data and support thousands of queries per second, HBase can easily support petabytes of data and millions of queries per second!

If you're considering HBase for your data storage needs, learning about the HBase data model and architecture is critical. This Meetup will give you hands-on HBase experience. You will go through the basics of how to install HBase, create schemas and tables, query your data, backup your tables, manage, monitor and tune HBase. You’ll also learn about the various client options including Big SQL and Hive.

This Meetup is FREE. Food and beverages will be provided. Please bring your laptop to participate in the hands-on lab. Download BigInsights Quick Start Edition before the event: http://ibm.co/QuickStart

Agenda:

5:30-6:30: Networking (Food & Beverages provided)

6:30-7:15: Presentation

7:15-9:30: Hands-on with HBase

Download the VM: http://ibm.co/QuickStart

Download the HBase Sample Data: http://bigdatauniversity.com/courses/course/view.php?id=513

Enrollment Key: meet123up
name: Big Data Meetup: Hands-on with HBase

description:
Register Today for this special event - ibm.biz/Bdxk4n Note -Space is limited, Clicking the YES attending button does not confirm your registration for this event - only registration and a confirmation from IBM.

Intended for:

IBM Business Partners, Independent Software Vendors (ISVs), System Integrators, and resellers Global Entrepreneur Partners Applications Developers Meet with the Technologists Behind IBM’s Big Data Solutions - Connect to Win

Learn about IBM’s Big Data solutions for IBM Business Partners. See how quickly you can enter this fast growing, highly profitable market segment.

Every day, we create 2.5 quintillion bytes of data — so much that 90% of the data in the world today has been created in the last two years alone. This data comes from everywhere: sensors used to gather climate information, posts to social media sites, digital pictures and videos, purchase transaction records, and cell phone GPS signals to name a few. This data is Big Data. IBM’s Big Data solutions enables customers to take advantage of the growing Big Data opportunity by providing information and analytics capabilities to extract insights from both enterprise data and all the big data that is continuously flowing in from a variety of new sources.

Anjul Bhambhri, IBM Vice President of Development for Big Data, as well as experts from across IBM are eager to meet with you to build your knowledge about how IBM helps clients gain a competitive advantage with innovative software and systems designed for the era of big data.

Highlights

Learn how our solutions:

Enable continuous analysis of massive volumes of streaming data with sub-millisecond response times. Manage and analyze massive volumes of structured and unstructured data with an enterprise-ready, Apache Hadoop-based solution. Provide real-time access and fusion of big data with rich and varied data from enterprise applications for greater insight and ROI via discovery and navigation software. Metadata Modeling (Framework Manager) and Lab Architecture, Integration and Systems Management. This half-day meeting is a great opportunity to:

Discover more about the IBM PartnerWorld initiative for Big Data designed to create new business opportunities and accelerate your growth. Network and identify business partners and ISV relationships that can bring together different capabilities and strengths. Learn more about the IBM's Big Data solutions designed to help you compete and profit in today's Smarter Planet. Stay for the networking reception immediately following the meeting!

Due to limited seating, registration is required on ibm.biz/Bdxk4n. Please bring your IBM confirmation to the event.

Join us on Thursday, September 12th at 6:30pm to learn about Hadoop Security and Audit.

The value of the fast growing class of big data technologies is the ability to handle high velocity and volumes of data. However, a lack of robust security and auditing capabilities are holding organizations back from fully using the potential of these systems. Learn how you can use Big Data technologies to help you meet this compliance and data protection challenge head on so you can return to innovating for competitive advantage.

Using InfoSphere Guardium and BigInsights, we'll show you how you can meet your Hadoop security, compliance and audit requirements. Food and beverages will be provided!

Agenda:

6:30pm: Doors Open

6:30pm-7pm: Registration / Food and Beverages provided

7:00pm: Hadoop Security and Audit presentation

7:45-8pm: Break

8pm: Live Demo

8:30pm: Networking
name: Big Data Meetup: Hadoop Security and Audit

description:
Streaming data is all around us – from social media feeds to call data records – but can be difficult to leverage. Sometimes there is simply too much data to collect and store before analyzing it. Sometimes it’s an issue of timing – by the time they store data on disk, analyze it, and respond – it’s too late. Organizations need a way to harness the natural resource of streaming data and turn it into actionable insight. Enter stream computing.

Stream computing changes where, when and how much of your business data you can analyze. By extracting insight from data as it is streaming, you can react to events as they are happening to reshape business outcomes. Store less, analyze more, and make better decisions, faster. From increased customer retention to earlier fraud detection to more frequent cross-selling, the benefits of stream computing are many.

______________________

Here is a map to the meeting location.

Enter the building from the ground floor lobby and use the south elevator bank to go to the 5th floor.

Please note - the doors close at 6:00 pm. Plan to arrive early enough to be in the room by 5:45 - for networking and pizza. You may come as early as 5:00.
name: Stream Computing - Real-time analytics processing for actionable insight

description:
Big Data Meetup: Hands-on with Text Analytics - Extracting business value from Text

Join us on Tuesday, September 24th at 6:00pm in Foster City. This Meetup will be a presentation, demo and hands-on lab.

As enterprises seek to gain operational efficiencies and competitive advantage through greater use of analytics, much of the new information they need to analyze is found in text documents and, increasingly, in a wide variety of social media sites and portals. A critical step in gaining insights from this information is extracting core data from huge volumes of text. That data is then available for downstream analytic, mining and machine learning tools. AQL (Annotator Query Language) is a powerful declarative, rule-based language for the extraction of information from text documents.

This Meetup is FREE. Food and beverages will be provided. Please bring your laptop to participate in the hands-on lab. Download BigInsights Quick Start Edition (single-node) before the event: http://ibm.co/QuickStart

Agenda:

6:00-6:30: Networking (Food & Beverages provided)

6:30-7:15: Presentation/Demo

7:30-9:30: Hands-on with Text Analytics

Download the VM (single-node): http://ibm.co/QuickStart

For Windows - VMware Player (free download) is required to run a VMware image: https://my.vmware.com/web/vmware/free#desktop_end_user_computing/vmware_player/6_0

For Mac - VMware Fusion (free trial) https://www.vmware.com/products/fusion/

Download the Text Analytics Hands on Lab and Sample Data: http://bigdatauniversity.com/courses/course/view.php?id=513

description:
Join us on Tuesday, October 15th at 6:30pm to learn about "Distilling Insights from Social Media Using Big Data Technologies".

Have you ever wondered what your customers are saying about you in Social media, and the impact it might be having on your business? This session will focus on how Big Data technologies can be used to glean useful and actionable insights from social media data.

You'll see how data can be ingested and prepped and do text analytics on social data in real time. Using Hadoop, we'll show you how you can store and analyze your large volume of historical social media data and reference data. This talk and demo will provide an introduction to text analytics and how it is used within the IBM Big Data platform for a social media solution.

This Meetup is FREE. Food and Beverages will also be provided.

description:
IBM is pleased to announce a Proof of Technology event for IBM BigInsights (an Enterprise Hadoop solution) to analyze BigData to be held on Tuesday Oct 22, 2013, in the IBM Phoenix office.

For those unfamiliar with IBM's Proof of Technology sessions, they are a combination of lecture and hands-on labs in order give attendees hands-on experience with the products. This BigInsights PoT will be unique in that all attendees will be given a copy of the free distribution version of BigInsights. Meetup Group Attendees must bring their own personal laptops to load the distribution and use their own laptop for class labs.

About BigInsights:IBM® Big Data addresses key customer enterprise data requirements and provides a robust platform for the three V's: Variety, Velocity and Volume. Built on a foundation of open source components, IBM extends the platform to provide additional analytics, enhanced ease of use, and extensive integration to provide an enterprise class solution. In this Proof of Technology, we will explore data at rest using IBM InfoSphere Big Insights. This session consists of both presentation and hands-on lab exercises.

Objective:IT professionals can gain experience with Big Data and IBM's offerings in this fast moving area of computing..

Audience:This Proof of Technology is for Data analysts, Data Management Architects, Database Developers and other decision influencers who are evaluating IBM technologies

Agenda:• Welcome and Introduction• Lecture• Lab Exercise 1: BigInsights 2.0 Web Console• Lab Exercise 2: Social Media and BigSheets• Lunch courtesy of IBM• Lab Exercise 3: Querying social media and structured data: An introduction to Jaql• Lab Exercise 4: Text Analytics for Social Media Data: An introduction to AQL• Lab Exercise 5: Developing, publishing, and deploying your first Big Data application with InfoSphere BigInsights

Schedule:Continental breakfast will begin at 8:30 AMThe session will begin at 9:00 AM and end at 4:30 PMLunch will be provided.

Location:IBM Phoenix office, Room[masked] N Central AvePhoenix, AZ 85255

Additional Information:IBM BigInsights http://www-01.ibm.com/software/data/infosphere/biginsights/IBM BigData University http://www.bigdatauniversity.com/IBM BigData Hub http://www.ibmbigdatahub.com/

description:
Big Data Developers. The Big Data Developer Day - Big Data and the Evolving Data Warehouse, October 31st, registration site is closed. If you have not registered and would like to attend as a walk-in, please email Nancy Berlin - [masked].

REMINDER: YOU MUST REGISTER AT http://ibm.com/1b6XM9m TO SECURE A SEAT AT THE BIG DATA DEVELOPER DAY - BIG DATA AND THE EVOLVING DATA WAREHOUSE. SPACE IS LIMITED - REGISTER SOON.

Once you have joined the Meetup in NYC, please be sure to register at:

http://ibm.co/1b6XM9m in order to secure your space in the Big Data Developer Day on 10/31/13. Space is limited so please register soon.

Join us on Oct 31, 2013 to participate in an exclusive Big Data Developer Day hosted by the IBM Big Data team. Open source Apache Hadoop is a great framework for distributed processing of large data sets. But there’s a difference between "playing" with big data versus solving real problems. The reality is that Hadoop alone might not be enough. Experience IBM’s enterprise-class Hadoop product, InfoSphere BigInsights, which enhances open source Hadoop with required enterprise capabilities including: analytics, visualization, security, standard SQL, enterprise HBase, developer/admin tools, and more. The morning session will include interactive discussions and live demonstrations of IBM's view of the evolving Enterprise Data Warehouse and the role of hadoop (aka Data Warehouse Augmentation);

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JcCWvVIAAMA

and, in the afternoon, get hands-on with InfoSphere BigInsights Quick Start Edition with guidance from development experts. This is a unique opportunity to develop skills and learn about exciting technologies and techniques that you can immediately take back to your organization.

This event is FREE. Breakfast, Lunch and snacks will be provided.

9:30 am to 10:30 am Welcome and Keynote - Big Data & the Evolving Warehouse

10:30 am to 11:15 am SQL for Hadoop - Demo

11:15 am to 11:30 am Break

11:30 am to 12:15 pm Enterprise ready HBase

12:15 pm to 1:00 pm Lunch

• Getting started with Hive

• Leveraging the full power of SQL with Hadoop

• Simplifying HBase queries with IBM Big SQL

Labs will use BigInsights Quickstart VM. To learn more before hand try Big SQL on the cloud or Big Data University.

5:30 PM Close Thank You for Attending

Seating is limited, please adjust your RSVP accordingly.

To guarantee your seat, you must register here:

http://ibm.co/1b6XM9m

description:
Join us on Wednesday, November 13 for our next Big Data Developer Meetup!

This meetup will focus on Stream Computing and creating a Real-time Analytics Application. Doors open at 6pm for registration and networking, while the program starts at 6:30pm. This Meetup is FREE. Food & beverages will be provided.

With smart phones and fully instrumented cars, the amount of data we can collect from moving objects is growing at staggering rates. In a few years, the automotive industry will be the largest data producer of data after utilities -- bigger than health care. And with this Big Data volume comes Big Data challenges. The opportunity for applying all this data in real-time to problems in transportation, congestion management, emergency response, microweather prediction, supply chain management, and so on is tremendous. But this requires a real-time analytics platform that can integrate GPS locations, telematics messages and sensor readings, video, and other kinds of information--and scale up to any level. Beyond automotive applications, the need for a real-time big-data analytics platform is becoming critical in other industries, including Government, Telecommunications, Healthcare, Energy and Utilities, Finance, and Manufacturing.

Bring your laptop, because you'll have an opportunity to get hands-on with InfoSphere Streams and apply this exciting new technology yourself! If you're not ready to get your hands dirty, that's OK. We'll also be showing an additional deep dive demo of how to build a real-time analytics application.

Agenda

6pm: Registration & Networking (Food and beverages provided)

** Giveaway for the first 25 attendees **

6:30pm: Introduction to Real-Time Analytics and Stream Computing

7:15pm: Live Demo of a Real-time Analytics Use Case

7:30pm: Creating a Real-time Analytics Application

Room 1 - Hands-on -- Bring your laptops

Room 2 - Deep-dive demo -- Sit back and watch the experts show you step by step.

If you plan to get hands-on, here are additional details:

Bring your own laptop. Download the Streams Quick Start Edition VMware image: ibm.co/streamsqs

The Streams Quick Start Edition is free. There is no data capacity and no time limitation, so you can experiment with large data sets and work with different use cases, on your own timeframe.

If you've never run a VMware image before, you'll need VMPlayer (Windows/Linux) or VMFusion (Mac).

This short demo will take you step by step through the Streams Quick Start Edition setup: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y2L4DNZQAwk

If you want to get a head start, check out the new Streams developer community: ibm.co/streamsdev

Download the Streams Hands-on Lab: http://bigdatauniversity.com/courses/course/view.php?id=513

Enrollment Key: meet123up
name: Hands-on with Stream Computing: Creating a Real-time Analytics Application

description:
THIS IS A WEB CONFERENCE ONLY - TIME INDICATED IS LOCAL START TIME. SEE BELOW FOR DETAILS.

IBM InfoSphere Streams V3.2 (referred to as Streams) delivers a highly scalable, agile software infrastructure to perform in-motion analytics on a wide variety of relational and non-relational data types that enter the enterprise at unprecedented volumes and speed, and from thousands of real-time sources. Streams V3.2 includes new features and functions designed to instantly analyze and fuse massive volumes of data and integrates with existing infrastructures. It delivers new capabilities to improve usability, support enterprise readiness, and streamline enterprise integration.

WHAT:

The following new features and functions, which will be covered during the Streams Developer Conference:

Usability:• Remote Development with Streams Studio for Windows and Linux• User Defined Parallelism• Java Streams development simplification

Enterprise readiness:• Operational Decision Management adapter for business rules• Access to application data using Representational State Transfer (REST)

Enterprise integration:• MQTT adapters• Hadoop Big SQL support• HP Vertica Analytic Database support

Who should attend:

The event assumes you are familiar with Streams. If you are not, please either try the Big Data University Streams course or review some of the Streams videos on YouTube.

WHEN:

Webcast on Thursday November 14, 2013 from 10:00AM to 6:00PM U.S. Eastern Standard Time.

WHERE:

The webcast will be recorded and posted to Big Data University (BDU) at the following Big Data University course ID.

NOTE: There will be no physical location for this meetup and it will all be online.

To get more info, download presentations, get detailed agenda and to register for the event check out the BDU Streams Developers Virtual Conference landing page.

The detailed agenda will be posted at the BDU class/event page after Oct 31.

Please join us on the live LotusLive meeting webcast. The conference ID is 2058889. Audio in listen only mode will be available on the webcast.

To ask questions during Q&A periods, please use the following conference information:

USA Toll-Free:[masked]

USA Caller Paid:[masked]

For Other Countries call in numbers use this link.

Participant Code:[masked]

We look forward to sharing details about these new capabilities.

name: Streams 3.2 Developers Virtual Conference

description:
REGISTRATION FOR ST. LOUIS IS CLOSED. IF YOU HAVE NOT REGISTERED YET, PLEASE COME TO THE EVENT AND WE CAN REGISTER YOU ON-SITE.

BIG DATA DEVELOPERS: The location for the Big Data Developers Day in St. Louis has changed. We will now hold the Developers Day at Monsanto - located in Maryland Heights. Address is indicated above.

If you have RSVP'd, you still need to register at this link in order to guarantee your seat:

http://ibm.co/174lmkq

Join us and participate in an exclusive Big Data Developer Day hosted by the IBM Big Data team. Open source Apache Hadoop is a great framework for distributed processing of large data sets. But there’s a difference between "playing" with big data versus solving real problems. The reality is that Hadoop alone might not be enough. Experience IBM’s

enterprise-class Hadoop

product, InfoSphere BigInsights, which enhances open source Hadoop with required enterprise capabilities including: analytics, visualization, security, standard SQL, enterprise HBase, developer/admin tools, learn about the role of

Big Data in Motion

,

Big Data Exploration

and more. The morning session will include interactive

Big Data use case

discussions, an overview of what is big data, live demonstrations of key Big Data components (Big Data at Rest, Big Data in Motion).

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B27SpLOOhWw&list=PL7FnN5oi7Ez_p0XyFGI_XDF6C8Hj4R6-k&index=18

and, in the afternoon, get hands-on with Big Data using InfoSphere BigInsights Quick Start Edition and InfoSphere Streams Quick Start Edition with guidance from development experts. This is a unique opportunity to develop skills and learn about exciting technologies and techniques that you can immediately take back to your organization.

This event is FREE. Breakfast, Lunch and snacks will be provided.

Agenda (subject to change) 9:00 am to 9:30 am Breakfast & Registration

9:30 am to 10:30 am Welcome and Keynote - Big Data Overview

10:30 am to 11:15 am Big Data @ Rest (Hadoop) & Demo

11:15 am to 11:30 am Break

11:30 am to 12:15 pm Big Data in Motion & Demo

12:15 pm to 1:00 pm Lunch

1:00 pm to 5:00 pm Hands-on Lab - tentative labs

• Getting started with Haddop

• Leveraging the full power of SQL with Hadoop, Text Analytics, etc ..

• Get started with Stream Analytics

Labs will use BigInsights Quickstart VM and Streams Quickstart VM. Here is a video on how to setup the BigInsights Quickstart VM. To learn more before hand and get hands on go to Big Data University.

5:30 PM Close Thank You for Attending

Seating is limited, please adjust your RSVP accordingly.

To guarantee your seat, you must register here:

http://ibm.co/174lmkq

Registration is required. This event is limited to only 50 seats. You may let others know that you are going to this event by clicking on the YES RSVP button on this Meetup page—however— your seat can not be guaranteed until you officially register at the link above.

Thanks and we look forward to seeing you soon!

IBM InfoSphere Streams V3.2 (referred to as Streams) delivers a highly scalable, agile software infrastructure to perform in-motion analytics on a wide variety of relational and non-relational data types that enter the enterprise at unprecedented volumes and speed, and from thousands of real-time sources. Streams V3.2 includes new features and functions designed to instantly analyze and fuse massive volumes of data and integrates with existing infrastructures. It delivers new capabilities to improve usability, support enterprise readiness, and streamline enterprise integration.

WHAT:

The following new features and functions, which will be covered during the Streams Developer Conference:

Usability:• Remote Development with Streams Studio for Windows and Linux• User Defined Parallelism• Java Streams development simplification

Enterprise readiness:• Operational Decision Management adapter for business rules• Access to application data using Representational State Transfer (REST)

Enterprise integration:• MQTT adapters• Hadoop Big SQL support• HP Vertica Analytic Database support

Who should attend:

The event assumes you are familiar with Streams. If you are not, please either try the Big Data University Streams course or review some of the Streams videos on YouTube.

WHEN:

Webcast on Thursday November 14, 2013 from 10:00AM to 6:00PM U.S. Eastern Standard Time.

WHERE:

The webcast will be recorded and posted to Big Data University (BDU) at the following Big Data University course ID.

NOTE: There will be no physical location for this meetup and it will all be online.

To get more info, download presentations, get detailed agenda and to register for the event check out the BDU Streams Developers Virtual Conference landing page.

The detailed agenda will be posted at the BDU class/event page after Oct 31.

Please join us on the live LotusLive meeting webcast. The conference ID is 2058889. Audio in listen only mode will be available on the webcast.

To ask questions during Q&A periods, please use the following conference information:

USA Toll-Free:[masked]

USA Caller Paid:[masked]

For Other Countries call in numbers use this link.

Participant Code:[masked]

We look forward to sharing details about these new capabilities.

description:
Join us and participate in an exclusive Big Data and Analytics Developer Evening hosted by the IBM Big Data and Analytics team. Open source Apache Hadoop is a great framework for distributed processing of large data sets. But there’s a difference between "playing" with big data versus solving real problems. The reality is that Hadoop alone might not be enough. Experience IBM’s enterprise-class Hadoop product, InfoSphere BigInsights, which enhances open source Hadoop with required enterprise capabilities including: analytics, visualisation, security, standard SQL, enterprise HBase, developer/admin tools.

We will kick off with Big Data use case discussions and an overview of what big data really is, and then move quickly to get hands-on with Big Data using InfoSphere BigInsights Quick Start Edition with guidance from development experts. This is a unique opportunity to develop skills and learn about exciting technologies and techniques that you can immediately take back to your organisation.

This event is FREE. Drinks and some food will be provided.

description:
Big Data Meetup: Hands-on with Text Analytics - Extracting business value from Text

Join us on Wednesday, November 20 at 6:00pm in Phoenix. This Meetup will be a presentation, demo and hands-on lab.

As enterprises seek to gain operational efficiencies and competitive advantage through greater use of analytics, much of the new information they need to analyze is found in text documents and, increasingly, in a wide variety of social media sites and portals. A critical step in gaining insights from this information is extracting core data from huge volumes of text. That data is then available for downstream analytic, mining and machine learning tools. AQL (Annotator Query Language) is a powerful declarative, rule-based language for the extraction of information from text documents.

description:
Join us on Thursday, December 5th at 6:00pm to learn how we can gain new insights by analyzing machine logs using Machine Data Analytics.

Half of Fortune 500 companies experience more than 80 hours of system down time annually. Spread evenly over a year, that amounts to approximately 13 minutes every day. As a consumer, the thought of online bank operations being inaccessible so frequently is disturbing. As a business owner, when systems go down, all processes come to a stop. Work in progress is destroyed and failure to meet SLA’s and contractual obligations can result in expensive fees, adverse publicity, and loss of current and potential future customers. Ultimately the inability to provide a reliable and stable system results in loss of $$$’s. While the failure of these systems is inevitable, the ability to timely predict failures and intercept them before they occur is now a requirement.

A possible solution to the problem can be found is in the huge volumes of diagnostic big data generated at hardware, firmware, middleware, application, storage and management layers indicating failures or errors. Machine analysis and understanding of this data is becoming an important part of debugging, performance analysis, root cause analysis and business analysis. In addition to preventing outages, machine data analysis can also provide insights for fraud detection, customer retention and other important use cases.

This Meetup is FREE. Food and Beverages will also be provided.

Agenda:

6:00pm-7pm: Registration / Food and Beverages

7:00pm: Topic Presentation

7:45-8pm: Break

8pm: Live Demo

8:30pm: Networking
name: Gain New Insights by Analyzing Machine Logs using Machine Data Analytics

description:
First Waltham Cloud Foundry Meetup Event

Food and Drink provided by Altoros (www.altoros.com)!

The afternoon is proposed to go like this:

Host Introductions

A Brief Introduction to Cloud Foundry: the Technology and the Community presented by Chris Ferris

Main Event - Implementation of Cloud Foundry 2.0 at NephoScale by Renat Khasanshyn

Main Event:

Part 1 (20 min) - Auto-scaling applications on OpenStack & AWS using Cloud Foundry as your private PaaS

Part 2 (10 min) - Case Study: Implementation of Cloud Foundry v 2.0 at NephoScale

Open Forum - This is YOUR meetup, so what would you like to achieve from this group, and what would you like presented at Future Meetups?

Refreshments served

===

About Renat Khasanshyn:

Renat is founder & CEO of Altoros, and Venture Partner at Runa Capital. Renat helps define Altoros's strategic vision, and its role in Cloud Foundry PaaS ecosystem. In the past, Renat has been selected as finalist for the Emerging Executive of the Year award by the Massachusetts Technology Leadership Council and once won an IBM Business Mashup Challenge. Prior to founding Altoros, Renat was VP of Engineering for Tampa-based insurance company PriMed. Renat is also founder of Apatar, an open source data integration toolset, founder of Silicon Valley NewSQL User Group and co-founder of the Belarusian Java User Group. He studied Engineering at Belarusian National Technical University.

About Chris Ferris:

Chris currently works as an IBM Distinguished Engineer and CTO for Cloud Interoperability in IBM Software Group's Standards Strategy organization. He has been involved in the architecture, design, and engineering of distributed systems for most of his 33+ year career and has been actively engaged in open standards and open source development since 1999. He currently provides technical leadership for IBM's engagements in OpenStack and Cloud Foundry, as well as for IBM's participation in open standards activities relevant to Cloud.

UPDATE: Visitor parking is on the 4th floor of the parking garage which leads to the 1st level of Building A (on the left when coming from the parking garage). See you on the 17th!!

DON'T MISS THIS GREAT OPPORTUNITY. RSVP HERE ON THIS MEETUP. MEETING WILL BE FIRST FLOOR OF THE IBM BUILDING ON BARFIELD.

Big data exploration addresses the challenge faced by every large organization: business information is spread across multiple systems and silos and people need access to that data to meet their job requirements and make important decisions. Big Data Exploration enables you to explore and mine big data to find, visualize, and understand all your data to improve decision making. By creating a unified view of information across all data sources - both inside and outside of your organization - you gain enhanced value and new insights.

Ask yourself:

• Are you struggling to manage and extract value from the growing volume and variety of data and need to unify information across federated sources?

• Are you unable to relate “raw” data collected from system logs, sensors, or click streams with customer and line-of-business data managed in your enterprise systems?

• Do you risk exposing unsecure personal information and/or privileged data due to lack of information awareness?

If you answered yes to any of the above questions, the big data exploration use case is the best starting point for your big data journey. Join us to learn more about this use case via a technical presentation and demo.

description:
Join us on Saturday, January 25th to learn more about real-time streaming data. This hackathon provides participants an opportunity to identify and extend applications leveraging streaming data to solve real world problems with InfoSphere® Streams, an advanced computing platform that allows user-developed applications to quickly ingest, analyze, and correlate information as it arrives from thousands of real-time sources.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eQpFgLYXr_E

The solution can handle very high data throughput rates, up to millions of events or messages per second. A component of the IBM big data platform, InfoSphere Streams processes huge volumes and varieties of data from diverse sources while achieving extremely low latency, enabling decision makers to extract relevant information for timely analysis.

Use Cases:

Over the past several years, hundreds of applications have been developed using InfoSphere Streams. Examples are:

• Telecommunications: Call Detail Record (CDR) processing to support billing mediation, network optimization, and customized client experiences

• Government: Monitoring and analysis of IP traffic for cyber security

• Financial services: Rapid analysis of large data volumes to make near real-time business and trading decisions

• Healthcare: Next generation medical care, analyze privacy-protected streams of medical-device data to detect early signs of disease, identify correlations among multiple patients, reduce alert fatigue, and measure efficacy of treatments

Transportation:

GPS data processing

from buses once every minute, driving a real-time display of all buses as they move through the city

description:
REMINDER: REGISTER AT LINK BELOW TO GUARANTEE YOUR SEAT. SEATING IS LIMITED - REGISTER NOW.

http://ibm.co/19APszk

Hive is a runtime Hadoop® support structure that allows anyone who is already fluent with SQL (which is commonplace for relational database developers) to leverage the Hadoop platform right out of the gate. Hive allows SQL developers to write Hive Query Language (HQL) statements that are similar to standard SQL statements. HQL statements are broken down by the Hive service into MapReduce jobs and executed across a Hadoop cluster.

IBM® Big SQL is a data warehouse system for Hadoop that you use to summarize, query, and analyze data. Big SQL provides SQL access to data that is stored in InfoSphere® BigInsights™ by using JDBC or ODBC connections. Big SQL provides broad SQL support that is typical of commercial databases. You can issue JDBC queries or ODBC queries to access data that is stored in InfoSphere BigInsights, in the same way that you access databases from your enterprise applications.

You can use Big SQL to issue queries of any size, including concurrent queries. Big SQL provides support for large ad-hoc queries by using MapReduce parallelism and point queries, which are low-latency queries that return information quickly to reduce response time and provide improved access to data.

HBase is a column-oriented database management system that runs on top of HDFS. It is well suited for sparse data sets, which are common in many big data use cases. Unlike relational database systems, HBase does not support a structured query language like SQL; in fact, HBase isn’t a relational data store at all. HBase applications are typically written in Java much like a MapReduce application or in other languages by using Apache Thrift. However, HBase can be queried with SQL when combined with Hive and or Big SQL!

Apache Accumulo, like HBase, derives from Google's BigTable technology. While the two technologies are similar in architecture, Accumulo excels in security right down to the cell level. Attendees will receive an introduction to Apache Accumulo and hear about IBM's Accumulo research project.

Join us from 11:00am - 6:00pm on February the 4th to learn about Big SQL, Hive and HBase. Register at: http://ibm.co/19APszk

Attendees will learn how these three technologies complement each other and experience hands-on

description:
Join IBM Subject Matter Experts as they discuss how machine data analysis can prevent outages, as well as provide insights for business imperatives such as fraud detection, customer retention, and other important use cases.

Machines produce huge amounts of data that contain valuable and actionable information. However, accessing and working with that information requires large-scale import, extraction, transformation, and statistical analysis. IBM® Accelerator for Machine Data Analytics, a set of end-to-end applications, helps you import, extract, index, transform, and analyze your data to perform faceted search and event and pattern correlation and then make informed decisions based on the intelligence contained in log and data files.With IBM Accelerator for Machine Data Analytics, you can:

-Search within and across multiple log entries based on a text search, faceted search, or a timeline-based search to find events -Enrich the context of log data by adding and extracting log types into the existing repository -Link and correlate events across systems -Uncover patterns
name: Machine Data Analysis- A Big Data Business Imperative!

description:
Topic: Technologies and architectural considerations for a holistic approach to big data security and privacy

Join on our next Meetup on Thursday, February 27th in San Jose, CA. This will be our first Meetup at the IBM office in San Jose.

Big data projects are challenging for many reasons, from scoping out the business problems to be solved, getting the right skills in place, and showing value to the organization. For this reason, some organizations have avoided the tough conversation around managing risk, including the fundamental conversation around information governance, and how to meet data privacy and data security obligations.

In this meetup, our speakers will discuss some approaches to integrating information governance into typical big data projects that include the use of Hadoop for exploration and analysis. This includes metadata management, data masking while maintaining analytical integrity, and monitoring to detect potential internal/external breaches and for demonstrating compliance to specific audit requirements.

Agenda:

6:00pm-7pm: Networking (Food & Beverages provided)

7:00pm: Presentation

7:45-8pm: Break

8pm: Live Demo

8:30pm: Networking
name: Considerations for a Holistic Approach to Big Data Security and Privacy

description:
Participe en un exclusivo Big Data Developer Day, organizado por el equipo de Big Data de IBM. El proyecto open source de Apache Hadoop es un excelente framework para proceso distribuído de grandes volúmenes de datos. Pero hay una diferencia entre "jugar" con big data y resolver problemas de verdad. La realidad es que sólo Hadoop puede que no sea suficiente. Experimente Hadoop de clase empresarial con el producto de IBM, InfoSphere BigInsights, que mejora la versión de open source de Hadoop con capacidades empresariales incluyendo: analíticos, visualización, seguridad, SQL estándar, HBase, herramientas de desarrollo/administración. Aprenda del conceptos como "Big Data in Motion", "Big Data Exploration" y más. La sesión de la mañana incluirá discusiones de casos de uso de Big Data, una vista general de lo que es Big Data, demostraciones en vivo de los componentes clave para manejar datos en movimiento y datos en reposo.

Description

BigData represents a new and fast growing era in data exploration and utilization. These course materials cover Hadoop fundamentals. Hadoop is an open-source implementation of frameworks for reliable, scalable, distributed computing and data storage which can be used for managing Big Data. Course modules cover Hadoop architecture, HDFS, MapReduce, Querying Data (Pig, Hive, JAQL) and Moving Data (Flume). Hands-on labs, using IBM BigInsights, are included in the course. BigInsights, which is based on Hadoop, is available as a virtual image. The course is approximately 8 hours of course content, including time for the labs.

description:
In last month's discussion, we discussed STREAMS and the use of Annotator Query Language (AQL) and other tools to analyze real time data.

Come learn how to boost your Text Analytics productivity and capabilities with AQL!!

This session we will discussAQL, a query language designed for Text Analytics which provides analysts and programmers a set of SQL-like expressions so it’s immediately familiar, making it easier to learn and develop. The engine was developed by IBM research. IBM has been working in this area for many years and regularly work with customers to extend and enhance its capabilities.

Why and What is Text Analytics?

Text Analytics is a way to extract information from unstructured and semi-structured documents. By extracting information from these documents, you can combine it with other more traditional structured information to get a more complete view of your business, your customers and your competitors. Most text documents are written by people to convey information to other people so they don't follow strict rules controlling content, layout and style. As a result, you can't use traditional ETL tools to extract information from them. Call center records are a good example. They often include fields containing the text of a dialog with a customer and notes and comments made by the call center rep. There's lots of valuable information in these fields, but you can't extract it using ETL tools. The same is true for social media and sentiment data. These new data sources contain huge amounts of very valuable information about your business, your customers and your competitors, but if you want to extract meaningful information from data from blogs, tweets, call center records and other unstructured documents you need Text Analytics.

Using Text Analytics we can make it easier to intelligently search and access information from these documents and we can open up the information to traditional Business Intelligence and warehousing tools and technologies. Machines are very good at quickly applying unambiguous rules that can be precisely encoded; but processing documents using rule based or grammar based extraction techniques doesn’t work very well; there's just too much variability and these systems usually become ‘brittle’. IBM Text Analytics is based on a system that lets you identify elements of interest and their context without writing complex and fragile grammars and rules. Think of the way you scan a document, identifying information of interest, determining the context and then extracting the information you need. IBM Text Analytics uses a similar machine based model.
name: AQL - Annotator Query Language

Are you a born-on-the-web and mobile developer, or startup/entrepreneur, or an independent software vendor looking to make services available in the cloud? Maybe you need to iterate on something quickly. Maybe you want to experiment with different technologies. Maybe you just want to build, extend, and deploy with the efficiency of a cold-blooded cyborg. Whatever you want to do, BlueMix offers a single solution environment that lets you develop, deploy and manage apps of all types (web, mobile, big data, new smart devices) across multiple domains. If the answer is yes to any of these questions, you don't want to miss this meetup session. You will learn how to to deploy your application and have it running in a matter of hours.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VOqmR2nSCHY

BlueMix is an implementation of IBM’s Open Cloud Architecture, leveraging Cloud Foundry to enable developers to rapidly build, deploy, and manage their cloud applications, while tapping a growing ecosystem of available services and runtime frameworks. Capabilities include Java, mobile backend development, application monitoring, Hadoop, as well as capabilities from ecosystem partners and open source — all through an as-a-service model in the cloud.

description:
For this meetup we've partnered with OpenStack Boston group to discuss more of how to auto-scale apps on OpenStack using Cloud Foundry as your private PaaS.

Overview:IT departments and hosting providers are increasingly adopting Platform as a Service in response to developer demand. Cloud Foundry PaaS dramatically reduces development cycles and accelerates time to market for developers and cloud operators alike. Enterprises seeking to leverage PaaS can now consider numerous options for both public and private deployments.

If you want to provide your colleagues or customers an easy way to developing, testing, and deploying their apps, this is a meetup to attend! That is, learn why and how you can get your own Platform as a Service on AWS or OpenStack. This session will shed the light on a path to offering high-impact application development platform as a service.

Attendees will learn:- Architectural constraints for applications in the world of PaaS- Deploy Cloud Foundry on AWS and OpenStack in 3 steps- Live demo of deploying an app in less than 30 seconds- A simple 3 node Cloud Foundry cluster reference architecture and life cycle considerations

Speaker:

Renat Khasanshyn is CEO of Altoros and Venture Partner at Runa Capital. Employing one of the largest pools of Cloud Foundry engineering expertise on the market, Altoros provides consulting and managed services on the intersection of Cloud Foundry, multi-cloud deployment automation of Cloud Foundry, PaaS application architecture and integration with SQL/NoSQL/Hadoop. Mr. Khasanshyn is also founder of Apatar, an open source data integration toolset, founder of Silicon Valley NewSQL User Group and co-founder of the Belarusian Java User Group.

One more great session at the OpenStack meetup:Amrith Kumar the CTO of ParElastic will cover will provide an introduction to a Database as a Service on OpenStack and will dive into an architectural overview of the Trove project and how to architect and deliver database as a service for your users. Trove is an open source project in OpenStack that delivers highly scalable, available database as a service for MySQL (and more in future).

Amrith is a founder and the chief technology officer of ParElastic. He brings over two decades of experience delivering industry- leading products for companies specializing in enterprise storage applications, fault tolerant high performance systems and massively parallel databases. He also holds 4 patents. Most recently, he served as vice president of technology and product management at Dataupia, a maker of the Satori Data Warehousing platform. Prior to Dataupia, Amrith served as director and general manager at Sepaton, where he was responsible for the development of the core VTL product. Earlier, as a director of product development at Netezza, he managed end-to-end product delivery for all customers and prospects.

Reminders:

A light dinner and soft drinks will be provided ~ 6:30pm courtesy of Altoros, and we will kick off the sessions ~ 7:00pm.

• DON'T FORGET - for security reasons, the NERD center requires atendees to show a government issued photo ID in order to gain access into the building.

Best option for parking is the NERD center parking garage which charges a flst rate after 4pm.

Join us on Thursday, April 17th for a Special Event: Streams Developer Day - Let's get hands-on with Streaming Analytics

This Developer Day will focus on Stream Computing and creating a Real-time Analytics Application. Doors open at 8:00 am for registration and networking, while the program starts at 9:00 am.

With smart phones and fully instrumented cars, the amount of data we can collect from moving objects is growing at staggering rates. In a few years, the automotive industry will be the largest data producer of data after utilities -- bigger than health care. And with this Big Data volume comes Big Data challenges. The opportunity for applying all this data in real-time to problems in transportation, congestion management, emergency response, microweather prediction, supply chain management, and so on is tremendous. But this requires a real-time analytics platform that can integrate GPS locations, telematics messages and sensor readings, video, and other kinds of information--and scale up to any level. Beyond automotive applications, the need for a real-time big-data analytics platform is becoming critical in other industries, including Government, Telecommunications, Healthcare, Energy and Utilities, Finance, and Manufacturing.

Bring your laptop, because you'll have an opportunity to get hands-on with InfoSphere Streams and apply this exciting new technology yourself! If you're not ready to get your hands dirty, that's OK. We'll also be showing an additional deep dive demo of how to build a real-time analytics application.

Agenda

8:00 am - Doors Open - Registration and Welcome

9:00 am - Introduction to Real Time Analytics

9:30 am - Demo and Lab Introduction

or

If you plan to participate in the hands-on labs, please bring your own laptops. Some additional details here:

Bring your own laptop. Download the Streams Quick Start Edition VMware image: ibm.co/streamsqs

The Streams Quick Start Edition is free. There is no data capacity and no time limitation, so you can experiment with large data sets and work with different use cases, on your own timeframe.

If you've never run a VMware image before, you'll need VMPlayer (Windows/Linux) or VMFusion (Mac).

If you want to get a head start, check out the new Streams developer community: ibm.co/streamsdev

We look forward to seeing you there. Please be sure to register at:

Join us and participate in an exclusive Big Data Developer Day hosted by the IBM Big Data team. Open source Apache Hadoop is a great framework for distributed processing of large data sets. But there’s a difference between "playing" with big data versus solving real problems. The reality is that Hadoop alone might not be enough. Experience IBM’s enterprise-class Hadoop product, InfoSphere BigInsights, which enhances open source Hadoop with required enterprise capabilities including: analytics, visualization, security, standard SQL, enterprise HBase, developer/admin tools, learn about the role of Big Data in Motion, Big Data Exploration and more. The morning session will include interactive Big Data use case discussions, an overview of what is big data, live demonstrations of key Big Data components (Big Data at Rest, Big Data in Motion).

Hadoop Developer Day -- Let's get hands-on with Hadoop

REGISTRATION IS CLOSED. WE CURRENTLY HAVE A WAITLIST AND IF THERE ARE CANCELLATIONS, WE CAN ACCOMMODATE ADDITIONAL PEOPLE. HOWEVER, OUR SEATING CAPACITY IS LIMITED FOR THIS EVENT SO IF YOU HAVE NOT BEEN CONFIRMED THROUGH THE IBM REGISTRATION FOR THIS EVENT, PLEASE CHECK BACK WITH THE MEETUP GROUP FOR ADDITIONAL EVENTS IN THE NEAR FUTURE.

Want to learn more about Hadoop and the Big Data Problems it can solve? How about the key open source components related to Hadoop? Or, understand how Big Data solutions can work in the cloud? Or understand the components of Hadoop and how to leverage HDFS? Then this Hadoop Developer Day is for you. You will learn what the essential steps are involved with implementing a MapReduce program that runs in Hadoop as well as use IBM InfoSphere BigInsights tools to simplify the development and deployment of MapReduce programs. You will learn how to use Hive to implement data warehousing solutions in a Hadoop environment (using HiveQL), understand the IBM BigSQL approach to managing structured data in Hadoop and use IBM BigSQL to store and query large data sets in Hadoop.

description:
Are you looking for free, enterprise quality software and services you can use without having to spend time managing any of the infrastructure yourself? IBM DevOps Services (IDS) and BlueMix may be just what you're looking for! In this meetup, we'll introduce you to IDS, a Software as a Service offering you can use to collaborate with others to plan, track, develop, and deploy software to BlueMix. BlueMix is a Platform as a Service offering for building, managing, and running applications of all types. You can even setup a build pipeline in IDS that will build your application, run your unit tests, and deploy your application to BlueMix whenever a change is pushed to your code repository!

In this session, we'll do a live demo of IDS so you can see the planning, tracking, developing, and deploying functionality for yourself. We'll also discuss how you can leverage BlueMix for your next big thing.

There is no entry fee. Lunch will be provided.

Codename: Bluemix is available for Free Beta Now, sign up at www.bluemix.net

description:
NOTE: You will need to supply your full name, email, and company/organization upon RSVP. This is for security at the EMC building. You should have received a meetup email letting you know how to provide the information. When you arrive please tell the guard desk your contact is Tim Coventry-Cox.

Cloud Foundry is a complex distributed system that features a range of components which provide a faster and easier way to build, test, deploy and scale applications. We will go through the most important elements and capabilities that make Cloud Foundry a first class citizen PaaS.

As a developer, you will learn to evaluate if Cloud Foundry is a good fit for your awesome app.

• What Cloud Foundry is not?• Will my app run on Cloud Foundry just as it is? • How do you deploy apps to Cloud Foundry? • How do I scale my app up and down? • How do I know if something goes wrong, how do my apps perform?

From an ops or DevOps point of view, you will learn about ways to deploy Cloud Foundry.

• Your local machine• AWS• OpenStack on HP Cloud• Others?

We’ll also cover how Cloud Foundry solves issues of portability, scalability, reliability and extensibility.

Speaker:Renat Khasanshyn (@renatco) is CEO of Altoros Systems and Venture Partner at Runa Capital. Employing one of the largest pools of Cloud Foundry engineering expertise on the market, Altoros provides consulting and managed services on the intersection of Cloud Foundry, multi-cloud deployment automation of Cloud Foundry, PaaS application architecture and integration with SQL/NoSQL/Hadoop. Mr. Khasanshyn is also founder of Apatar, an open source data integration toolset, founder of Silicon Valley NewSQL User Group and co-founder of the Belarusian Java User Group. He studied Engineering at Belarusian National Technical University.

Refreshments will be provided by Altoros.

name: IBM Watson Cognitive Computing Deep Dive

description:
Streaming data originates from a myriad of sources both internal and external to the enterprise. From such diverse sources as social media feeds, Call Detail Records (CDRs), consumer transactions, financial markets, machine sensors, etc., streaming data is present in virtually every modern business process and social interaction. However, the sheer speed and volume of this data type makes it difficult to leverage using conventional systems.

Typically, there is too much data to collect, store, and analyze in a timely fashion. By the time data is stored on disk and analyzed, the response is no longer relevant. Organizations need a system that captures the value of streaming data in near-real-time and transforms it into actionable insight. – Enter IBM InfoSphere® Streams.

Streams processing is a new computing model that affects the “when,” “where,” and “how” of enterprise data analysis. By processing data as soon as it is captured, the enterprise can react rapidly to events as they occur, resulting in optimized business outcomes. From increased customer retention; to earlier fraud detection; to more productive cross-selling, the benefits of streams processing are many. IBM InfoSphere Streams uses innovative technology to perform rapid real-time analysis of information originating from a myriad of disparate sources resulting in positive outcomes for the enterprise. This Meet-Up session introduces participants to the capabilities of the IBM InfoSphere® Streams platform. The objective of this session is to demonstrate, via simple use cases, the features of the InfoSphere Streams platform. We also present the IBM InfoSphere® Streams Integrated Development Environment (IDE) and deployment tools.
name: Don't LAND it!  LEARN from it!  STREAMING ANALYTICS!!

description:
This meetup will be geared towards:

- DevOps professionals- Enterprise and solution architects- IT Operations & Management

Refreshments: Pizza and soft drinks to be provided by IBM.

Agenda:

Brief Cloud Foundry Ecosytem Update - Ryan Baxter, IBM

Quick Intro to BlueMix from IBM BlueMix team

Main Talk: Selecting and operating a PaaS from Renat Khasanshyn @ Altoros:

Part 1: Draft of the framework for selecting a PaaS.

- 5 dimensions that influence selection of a PaaS platform (any PaaS platform)

- Quick drill down into each dimension

- Ideas how various PaaS products may score against each dimension

- Comparison of Elastic Beanstalk and Cloud Foundry

- Collective brainstorming on what the selection criteria might be for various types of stakeholders

Part 2: What about Cloud Foundry?

- Too many Cloud Foundry PaaS-es? How do they compare?

- What's in it for me? Overview of what Cloud Foundry can do for Developers, DevOps, IT Operations & Management

- 5 business cases for Cloud Foundry

- How do I evangelize Cloud Foundry in my organization? A 3 step approach.

About Renat Khasanshyn:

Renat is founder & CEO of Altoros, and Venture Partner at Runa Capital. Employing one of the largest pools of Cloud Foundry engineering expertise on the market, Altoros provides consulting and managed services on the intersection of Cloud Foundry, multi-cloud deployment automation of Cloud Foundry, PaaS application architecture and integration with SQL/NoSQL/Hadoop. In the past, Renat has been selected as finalist for the Emerging Executive of the Year award by the Massachusetts Technology Leadership Council and once won an IBM Business Mashup Challenge. Prior to founding Altoros, Renat was VP of Engineering for Tampa-based insurance company PriMed. Renat is also founder of Apatar, an open source data integration toolset, founder of Silicon Valley NewSQL User Group and co-founder of the Belarusian Java User Group. He studied Engineering at Belarusian National Technical University.

About Ryan Baxter:

Ryan Baxter is a developer advocate in IBM’s Emerging Internet Technologies. Ryan is OpenSocial Foundation Member and Apache Shindig Committer. Ryan's background is in software engineering, so he is interested in all things code.

Directions and parking info:

- We are located at 1 Rogers Street Cambridge, MA which is a U shaped building positioned between Edwin H. Land Blvd and 1st Street. The auditorium is located off the lobby on the 1st floor. The sign on the front of the building states "One Charles Park" which can sometimes confuse guests.

- Parking is located across the street at the Cambridgeside Galleria Mall located at 100 Cambridgeside Place. We can validate guest parking for a discounted rate (usually $3-11 depending on how long they are parked).

- Here is a map that shows where the mall is in relation to the center. Once you park your cars, you will take the elevator/escalator to the first floor of the mall. You will walk towards the end of the mall where the Cheesecake Factory and California Pizza Kitchen are located. The center is in the building directly across the street. You will have to walk along the side of the building, until you reach Rogers Street. From there, you will turn right and the front doors are located directly ahead.

Attendees will learn:

• Live demo of deploying an app in less than 30 seconds

• A simple 3 node Cloud Foundry cluster reference architecture and life cycle considerations

• Architectural constraints for applications in the world of PaaS

• How to deploy Cloud Foundry on OpenStack in 3 steps

Renat Khasanshyn (@renatco) is CEO of Altoros Systems and Venture Partner at Runa Capital. Employing one of the largest pools of Cloud Foundry engineering expertise on the market, Altoros provides consulting and managed services on the intersection of Cloud Foundry, multi-cloud deployment automation of Cloud Foundry, PaaS application architecture and integration with SQL/NoSQL/Hadoop. He studied Engineering at Belarusian National Technical University.

It will must be happened in the near future. We can be sure that millions of "power provider" lied on the roads, which "power provider" will provide easy, fast service to cars. e.g. Create a manage system for "power provider", and can listen every "power provider" node status, to schedule a maintenance plan.

It's brand new business for every company, and it's a "blue sea".

Let's discover the chance and take advantage.

We will discuss the various SQL on Hadoop alternatives and explore why such technologies have become an area of keen interest for many organizations. We will discuss the various alternatives (Drill, Impala, Hive, Hadapt, Tajo, Shark, HAWQ, Presto, Phoenix, Big SQL) and their pros/cons. We will share customer use cases for Warehouse Modernization and the role of SQL for Hadoop in this space, as well as discuss performance characteristics of SQL on Hadoop when running common query workloads.

Also hear from the IBM development team what are the technical challenges they faced developing their SQL on Hadoop solution, how they addressed those challenges and what are the next set of challenges they see in the evolution of SQL on Hadoop. We will provide an intro to Big SQL and demo. Big SQL delivers some exciting capabilities including comprehensive SQL functionality that leverages advanced SQL compiler/runtime all with low latency and high performance.

Learn more about Big SQL here. Check out new SQL on Hadoop white paper.

And then we will have a series of lightning talks:

• Enterprise Security for Hadoop

• R and Hadoop

• Text Analytics and Hadoop

• Spreadsheet simplicity for Hadoop

Stay tuned for more info!
name: A Leap Forward for SQL on Hadoop  & Lightning Talks @ Hadoop Summit

description:
!! Registration Required Before May 30, 2014 (see below), Limited Seating, auto Wait-listing!!

To register for this event, go to the IBM Internet of Things / NoSQL Events page at: http://tinyurl.com/m6zw5sd

Please join us for a FREE one-day technical event designed to give you hands-onexperience with IBM’s solution for Internet of Things / NoSQL environments,whether deployed in a public or private cloud or hosted in the data center.

A massive change is occurring in computing environments around the world.Unstructured data is flooding into organizations and companies are struggling tochoose between a relational or NoSQL database to handle it. While NoSQL offersdynamic elasticity with data and its organization, these databases lack essentialelements common to enterprise class databases. Today, IBM offers a solution that can natively handle NoSQL and structured data simultaneously giving you the flexibility and development speed of NoSQL with all the features andcharacteristics of an enterprise class database.

This roadshow will help you understand how application developers can use fullNoSQL functionality (including sharding) for complete plug-and-play compatibility with MongoDB and graph-store databases. They can access structured and unstructured data in a single statement and join them together as needed. These applications can use the enterprise-level capabilities of a structured database system including transaction support, backup and recovery, H/A, compression, enhanced scalability, security and access control. IBM's solution also enables the execution of comprehensive analytics using Cognos or other BI tools on NoSQL data in IBM's market-leading in-memory data warehouse acceleration technology, commonly referred to as BLU.

To register for the event, go to the IBM Internet of Things / NoSQL Events page at: http://tinyurl.com/m6zw5sd
name: Developer's Workshop: NoSQL functionality (including sharding)

BigData represents a new and fast growing era in data exploration and utilization. These course materials cover Hadoop fundamentals. Hadoop is an open-source implementation of frameworks for reliable, scalable, distributed computing and data storage which can be used for managing Big Data. Course modules cover Hadoop architecture, HDFS, MapReduce, Querying Data (Pig, Hive, JAQL). Hands-on labs, using IBM BigInsights, are included in the course. BigInsights, which is based on Hadoop, is available as a virtual image. The course is approximately 8 hours of course content, including time for the labs.

description:
Lessons Learned with the VirData Platform for Internet of Things and Machine-to-Machine Cloud Services

Join us on Thursday, June 5th at 6:00pm to learn more about the technical challenges overcome by the innovative implementation of the VirData - a platform for cloud-based monitoring and management services for Internet of Things (IoT) and machine-to-machine (M2M) services.

Live Stream:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TSt49yPBmW0

This sophisticated platform has been developed by Technicolor, a worldwide technology leader in the media and entertainment sector, who teamed with IBM to take advantage of IBM SoftLayer cloud capabilities to provide clients with elastic and scalable services. Virdata’s device and application monitoring and management service features a real-time and historical big data analytics stack. Several advanced development activities in the big data analytics and visualization technologies domains have paved the way for the IBM and Virdata relationship that is focused on delivering IoT and M2M services to the consumer electronics market as well as other markets on a worldwide basis.

Virdata’s game-changing approach to monitoring and managing IoT and M2M services is based on emerging cloud native technologies. Its cloud-agnostic architecture embraces open source technologies such as the Cloud Foundry and OpenStack initiatives. Technicolor is also collaborating with academic research facilities at the University of California, Berkeley, for new emerging real-time in-memory analytics stacks and Ghent University in Belgium for data analytics.

Agenda:

6pm: Doors open & Networking (Food and beverages provided)

7pm: Presentation and demo

Presenters:

Graham Mackintosh (IBM)

Joshua Rosenberg (Technicolor)

Nathan Bijnens (Technicolor)
name: Lessons Learned from the Internet of Things & Machine-to-Machine Cloud Services

REGISTRATION IS NOW CLOSED. YOU MAY REGISTER ONSITE AT BIG DATA DEVELOPER DAY IN MALVERN. BREAKFAST AND LUNCH PROVIDED.

Join us and participate in an exclusive Big Data Developer Day hosted by the IBM Big Data team and Micro Strategies Inc.

Open source Apache Hadoop is a great framework for distributed processing of large data sets. But there’s a difference between "playing" with big data versus solving real problems. The reality is that Hadoop alone might not be enough. Experience IBM’s enterprise-class Hadoop product, InfoSphere BigInsights, which enhances open source Hadoop with required enterprise capabilities including: analytics, visualization, security, standard SQL, enterprise HBase, developer/admin tools, learn about the role of Big Data in Motion, Big Data Exploration and more. The morning session will include interactive Big Data use case discussions, an overview of what is big data, live demonstrations of key Big Data components (Big Data at Rest, Big Data in Motion).

https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=B27SpLOOhWw

In the afternoon, get hands-on with Big Data using InfoSphere BigInsights Quick Start Edition  andInfoSphere Streams Quick Start Edition with guidance from development experts. This is a unique opportunity to develop skills and learn about exciting technologies and techniques that you can immediately take back to your organization.

This event is FREE. Breakfast, Lunch and snacks will be provided.

10:30 am to 11:15 am Big Data: Data Warehouse Modernization & Demo
