description:
Topic: Technologies and architectural considerations for a holistic approach to big data security and privacy

Join on our next Meetup on Tuesday, June 10th in Cambridge,MA. This will be our first Meetup at the IBM office in Cambridge.

Big data projects are challenging for many reasons, from scoping out the business problems to be solved, getting the right skills in place, and showing value to the organization. For this reason, some organizations have avoided the tough conversation around managing risk, including the fundamental conversation around information governance, and how to meet data privacy and data security obligations.

In this meetup, our speakers will discuss some approaches to integrating information governance into typical big data projects that include the use of Hadoop for exploration and analysis. This includes metadata management, data masking while maintaining analytical integrity, and monitoring to detect potential internal/external breaches and for demonstrating compliance to specific audit requirements.

Agenda:

6:00pm-7pm: Networking (Food & Beverages provided)

7:00pm: Presentation

7:45-8pm: Break

8pm: Live Demo

8:30pm: Networking
name: Considerations for a Holistic Approach to Big Data Security and Privacy

description:
We will discuss the various SQL on Hadoop alternatives and explore why such technologies have become an area of keen interest for many organizations. We will discuss the various alternatives (Drill, Impala, Hive, Hadapt, Tajo, Shark, HAWQ, Presto, Phoenix, Big SQL) and their pros/cons. We will share customer use cases for Warehouse Modernization and the role of SQL for Hadoop in this space, as well as discuss performance characteristics of SQL on Hadoop when running common query workloads.

Also hear from the IBM development team what are the technical challenges they faced developing their SQL on Hadoop solution, how they addressed those challenges and what are the next set of challenges they see in the evolution of SQL on Hadoop. We will provide an intro to Big SQL and demo. Big SQL delivers some exciting capabilities including comprehensive SQL functionality that leverages advanced SQL compiler/runtime all with low latency and high performance.

Learn more about Big SQL here. Check out new SQL on Hadoop white paper.
name: A Leap Forward for SQL on Hadoop

description:
You've read some posts, watched a few videos and maybe been to a meetup or two. Are you ready to get your hands on Cloud Foundry and maybe cut some code? Come join us for an evening of Cloud Foundry hacking. Designed for newbies and experienced Cloud Foundry practitioners alike, the format will be rather un-conference like. We will kick off the evening by proposing topics and forming teams of like-minded individuals to attack a problem. Some suggested topics are:

• Cloud Foundry getting started – push your first app(s) to Cloud Foundry - we’ll help you get an account on Pivotal Web Services or IBM Bluemix if you need it.

• Getting bosh-lite and cf-release running on your laptop or on AWS.

• How to build and deploy a service broker

• How to customize the java buildpack

• Building a BOSH release

• Create a pull request for Cloud Foundry - do you have one in mind?

We’ll have experts from the Cloud Foundry ecosystem, including Pivotal Web Services, IBM Bluemix and other partner engineers, on site as well as many even more able-bodied members of the Cloud Foundry community.

The event is open to CF Summit registrants as well as Cloud Foundry Community Meetup members.

Schedule: 5:30-6:00pm Pizza and Networking 6:00-6:30pm Topics and Group Formation 9:00pm Demos 10:00pm Adjourn

This is a FREE meetup, but requires a ticket through eventbrite because it is part of the Cloud Foundry Summit. Please register for your free ticket and make sure that you present your ticket (printed or mobile) when you arrive. (click here to register - http://bit.ly/CFHackNight0001)

description:
Join us and participate in an exclusive Big Data Developer Day hosted by the IBM Big Data team. Open source Apache Hadoop is a great framework for distributed processing of large data sets. But there’s a difference between "playing" with big data versus solving real problems. The reality is that Hadoop alone might not be enough. Experience IBM’s enterprise-class Hadoop product, InfoSphere BigInsights, which enhances open source Hadoop with required enterprise capabilities including: analytics, visualization, security, standard SQL, enterprise HBase, developer/admin tools, learn about the role of Big Data in Motion, Big Data Exploration and more. The morning session will include interactive Big Data use case discussions, an overview of what is big data, live demonstrations of key Big Data components (Big Data at Rest, Big Data in Motion).

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B27SpLOOhWw

and, in the afternoon, get hands-on with Big Data using InfoSphere BigInsights Quick Start Edition and InfoSphere Streams Quick Start Edition with guidance from development experts. This is a unique opportunity to develop skills and learn about exciting technologies and techniques that you can immediately take back to your organization.

This event will have snacks and we are working through lunch logistics, stay tuned.

description:
Hear about the latest SQL for Hadoop features in InfoSphere BigInsights component called Big SQL. It introduces a shared-nothing database architecture that leverages state of the art relational database technology from IBM. It provides a logical view of the data by allowing storage and management of metadata and a view of query compilation.

There is a leap forward with massive parallel processing SQL engine. It deploys directly on the physical Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) cluster. It introduces 'beyond Map Reduce' low latency parallel execution infrastructure that can access Hadoop data natively for reading and writing.

This session requires prior understanding of Hive relational database, SQL querying and Hadoop/MapReduce capabilities.

Download InfoSphere BigInsights Quick Start VM to get started on Big SQL capability.

Agenda

5:30 - 6:00 pm Registration/Refreshments

6:00 - 6:15 pm Introduction to Hadoop - BigInsights

6:30 - 7:15 pm IBM SQL Querying -What is it? -SQL capability -Architecture -Application Integration -Enterprise Capability -Performance

7:15 - 7:30 pm Questions/Next Steps

Please RSVP. Seats are limited.

description:
WebCast @IBM IIC Ehningen: Introducing Cloudant - the Do-More NoSQL Data Layer

Note: This is a WebCast only since we want that everybody benefits from the opportunity that Chris is in Europe.

Christopher Bienko is WW expert on Data Management in the Cloud and everybody will have the chance to ask questions in this session.

Technical deep-dives will follow this session.

Cloudant is based on Apache CouchDB but enhanced in serveral ways.

Cloudant is an innovator in data management, providing a NoSQL, JSON database-as-a-service (DBaaS) that enables developers of fast-growing Web and mobile applications to focus on developing their applications without the need to manage database infrastructure or growth. In this one hour introduction to Cloundant, we'll examine how Cloudant accelerates and extends IBM’s Big Data & Analytics portfolio. The agenda includes a review of the NoSQL database landscape, as well as specific features, use cases, and Cloudant customer success stories. Come and equip yourself with an understanding of this disruptive new technology for the world of databases.

Please register for this meetup, we will provide details for the Websession to all registered participants.

description:
Come and join use fo the look into BigSQL 3.0! Come for networking and Food at 6:30 PM and we'll get started at 7:00 PM. We look forward to seeing you there!

When considering SQL-on-Hadoop, the most fundamental question is: What is the right tool for the job? For interactive queries that require a few seconds (or even milliseconds) of response time, MapReduce (MR) is the wrong choice. On the other hand, for queries that require massive scale and runtime fault tolerance, an MR framework works well. MR was built for large-scale processing on big data, viewed mostly as “batch” processing.

As enterprises start using Apache Hadoop as a central data repository for all data — originating from sources as varied as operational systems, sensors, smart devices, metadata and internal applications — SQL processing becomes an optimal choice. A fundamental reason is that most enterprise data management and analytical tools rely on SQL.

As a tool for interactive query execution, SQL processing (of relational data) benefits from decades of research, usage experience and optimizations. Clearly, the SQL skills pool far exceeds that of MR developers and data scientists. As a general-purpose processing framework, MR may still be appropriate for ad hoc analytics, but that is as far as it can go with current technology.
name: Leverage what you already know with - SQL on Hadoop

Are you a born-on-the-web and mobile developer, or startup/entrepreneur, or an independent software vendor looking to make services available in the cloud? Are you looking to leverage Big Data in a fast and friendly manner? Maybe you need to iterate on something quickly. Maybe you want to experiment with different technologies. Maybe you just want to build, extend, and deploy with the efficiency of a cold-blooded cyborg. Whatever you want to do, Bluemix offers a single solution environment that lets you develop, deploy and manage apps of all types (web, mobile, big data, new smart devices) across multiple domains. If the answer is yes to any of these questions, you don't want to miss this meetup session. You will learn how to deploy your application and have it running in a matter of hours.
name: Building Applications using Open Cloud Platform as a Service

name: Blue Mix meetup
group_name: Shanghai PaaS, Bluemix and Cloud Computing Meetup

description:
Cloud Foundry is an open source Platform as a Service (PaaS) that changes the set of things that a devops individual interacts with when developing, deploying and managing cloud-based applications. No longer is that developer concerned with virtual machines, networks and storage, instead they are focused on and working with applications and the services they leverage.

After a brief introduction to the platform, in this meetup we will take a multi-tier application that was originally built for deployment onto physical or virtual machines, necessitating the deployment of numerous prerequisite softwares, and we’ll deploy it to Cloud Foundry, which provides all of those prerequisites out of the box. Only minor changes were made to the application with major benefits. We’ll provision services (i.e. database and messaging instances), deploy applications, bind them to those services and start up the app. The session will be light on slides and heavy on live demo.

The Cloud Foundry PaaS is entirely open sourced, available on Github and can be deployed on any number of IaaS including vSphere, OpenStack and AWS, plus there is an option where you can even run it on your laptop. Pivotal also offers it in the cloud at run.pivotal.io. If you come with a run.pivotal.io account and with thecli installed you’ll even be able to follow along and have a working app by the end of the evening.

About the speaker:

A self-proclaimed propeller head, Cornelia Davis works as a Platform Engineer in the Cloud Foundry group of Pivotal. Fundamentally responsible for making developers successful with the Cloud Foundry PaaS, you can generally find her knee deep in the (OSS) code base, writing apps and deploying them onto the PaaS, teaching at a whiteboard, presenting at conferences and passionately driving new features into the product.

When not doing those things you can find her on the yoga mat or in the kitchen.
name: Deploying a multi-tier application to Cloud Foundry
group_name: New York City Cloud Foundry Meetup

description:
The IBM Rochester Technical Vitality Council invites you to attend a special hands on 1.5 hour Meetup on June 25, 2014 from 4:00 to 5:30 pm at IBM Rochester. The topic for this Meetup will be: Cloud and Mobile Application Development using IBM's Bluemix cloud platform. This is not a sales meeting. Instead, IBM would like to make Bluemix available to as many technical developers as possible, free of charge. We would also like to provide an opportunity for technical developers in the Rochester area to collaborate and interact around this new service. There may be some time at the end to do some coding, so bring your laptop. Also, it will make things easier if you sign up for Bluemix prior to the Meetup at https://ace.ng.bluemix.net/.

What is BlueMix, exactly?

Bluemix is an open-standards, cloud-based platform for building, managing and running apps of all types (web, mobile, big data, new smart devices). Capabilities include support for multiple programming languages and runtimes including Java and Node.js, mobile backend development, application monitoring, as well as capabilities from ecosystem partners and open source — all through an as-a-service model in the cloud. To find out more information, go to the Bluemix website at https://ace.ng.bluemix.net/.

Hopefully you will want to join us for this exciting opportunity to "Meetup" with technical IBMers and other technical people in Rochester. We look forward to meeting with you soon.
name: Learn about IBM's new free cloud development platform, BlueMix

description:
Bringing world`s best IaaS to the world`s best PaaS, in this talk we are going to share our experiences of running CloudFoundry on OpenStack. The talk will focus on how CloudFoundry and OpenStack complement each other, how they technically integrate using Cloud provider interface (CPI), how to automate the integration and what are some of the best practices for configuring a scalable environment.

Finally we will introduce BlueMix - our PaaS solution powered by CloudFoundry and discuss extensions we have built.

For those who are interested, there will be an hour hands-on workshop for building applications on BlueMix as well.
name: Optimizing Cloud Foundry & OpenStack for large deployments (with Eats & Drinks)
group_name: Bay Area PaaS, Cloud Foundry & BlueMix Meetup

description:
Join us to hear about real world Hadoop usage patterns from NC State and IBM.

While much of the big data activity in the market up to now has been experimenting and learning about big data technologies, IBM has been focused on also helping organizations understand what problems big data can address. There are 5 key and evolving big data use cases that are emerging. John Choi will focus on the Hadoop usage pattern in these uses cases and will provide an updated view giving the quickly evolving Hadoop lanscape.

Dr. Kowolenko has been leveraging hadoop to analyze unstructured patent data to improve its ability to find a suitor for its patents. He will show case how companies our getting value from big data.

Our speakers:

John Choi - is Director of Big Data Product Management at IBM Software Group where he is responsible for product direction and strategy for the Big Data software portfolio. Prior to this role, he has held various product/portfolio management and strategy responsibilities in IBM including Information Management and WebSphere with a focusing on portfolio strategy and emerging technologies. John received his BA and MBA from Yale University.

Dr. Michael Kowolenko, Ph.D - is an Industry Fellow in the Center of Innovation Management Studies and Assistant Teaching Professor in the Departments of Accounting and Management at North Carolina State University Poole College of Management. His research and teaching activities focus on models of integrating data analytics in the area of critical thinking and decision-making. Dr. Kowolenko has been awarded multiple grants from IBM for his work in developing decision models enabled by Big Data. In addition, he has consulted with and instructed multiple companies in the use of analytics in business decision making.

Agenda

5:30 pm - 6:00 pm Registration/Refreshments

6:00 pm - 6:30 pm John Choi (Speaker) - Hadoop Use Case Discussion

6:30 pm - 7:00 pm Michael Kowolenko (Speaker) - Analytics Discussion

7:00 pm - 7:30 pm Questions/Next Steps

Please RSVP. Seats are limited.

Address: 3039 East Cornwallis Rd., Durham, NC 27709

Directions

1) Take I-40 West and take the Davis Dr. Exit #280. Turn right at the ramp.

2) Go 1.2 miles on Davis Drive to stoplight at Cornwallis Rd.

3) Go straight and enter IBM property through the Main Gate Visitor Entrance.

4) Inform security you are going to B002 Main Lobby.5) Follow signs to Executive Briefing Centers and park at B002 visitor lot.
name: NC State and IBM discussion of Hadoop Usage Patterns

description:
We will discuss the various SQL on Hadoop alternatives and explore why such technologies have become an area of keen interest for many organizations. We will discuss the various alternatives (Drill, Impala, Hive, Hadapt, Tajo, Shark, HAWQ, Presto, Phoenix, Big SQL) and their pros/cons. We will share customer use cases for Warehouse Modernization and the role of SQL for Hadoop in this space, as well as discuss performance characteristics of SQL on Hadoop when running common query workloads.

We will provide an intro to Big SQL and demo. Big SQL delivers some exciting capabilities including comprehensive SQL functionality that leverages advanced SQL compiler/runtime all with low latency and high performance.

Learn more about Big SQL here. Check out new SQL on Hadoop white paper.

In order to satisfy some security requirements for this IBM location, please answer the questions in the RSVP application.
name: A Leap Forward for SQL on Hadoop

Michael Wawra Twilio Blog - https://www.twilio.com/blog/author/michaelwawra

Unfortunately Matt is now unable to attend to talk about the iOS API - we will try and get him to come along at a future meetup. Matt Perrins from IBM leads the team that builds the mobile API for iOS for IBM Bluemix.

We will also be helping each other get started on IBM Bluemix, so bring along your favourite tablet or laptop to get connect and start using it. We have free wifi in the excellent Shoreditch Village Hall.

Finally, this is your meetup, so let's talk about what other topics you want to cover at future meetups. We have ideas - but bet you do too.

Looking forward to seeing you all at this meetup

description:
Data Management in the Big Mobile and Internet of Things Era – NoSQL Database as a Service with Cloudant, an IBM company

Today’s applications are expected to manage a variety of structured and unstructured data, accessed by massive networks of users, devices, and business locations, or even sensors, vehicles and Internet-enabled goods.

The Cloudant database as a service (DBaaS) is the first data management platform to leverage the availability, elasticity, and reach of the cloud to create a global data delivery network (DDN) that enables applications to scale globally and remain available to users wherever they are.

Cloudant is built from the ground up to scale globally (think CDN for your database), run non-stop, and handle a wide variety of indexing technologies including map-reduce, full-text search, and geo spatial. Cloudant is an operational data store optimized to handle concurrent reads & writes, and provide high availability and data durability.

Cloudant is used by Samsung, Adobe, Microsoft, Fidelity Investments, Hothead Games, and thousands of others who share Cloudant’s passion for database scalability and innovation. Cloudant provides them with:

Massive Read/Write ScalabilityNon-Stop Data AvailabilityFaster DevelopmentEscape from Cloud Lock-In
name: NOSQL Database as a Service - Scalability & Innovation

description:
ALL - room is in Building A, 2nd floor, Room 305.

Join IBM and Jeskell Systems LLC on Tuesday, July 29th at 6:30 pm to learn about, “Text-Analytics and Visualization using IBM Big Data Technologies"

Have you ever wondered what your customers are saying about you in Social Media, and the impact it might have on your day to day operations? How about enhancing Public Safety by empowering first responders with near-real time information in the context of fire, floods and other natural disasters.

As enterprises seek to gain operational efficiencies and competitive advantage through greater use of analytics, much of the new information they need to analyze is found in text documents, increasingly, in a wide variety of social media sites and portals.

During this meet-up, we will demonstrate two major Hadoop components:

• Text Analytics in Hadoop powered by Annotator Query Language (AQL). AQL is a powerful declarative, rule-based language for the extraction of information from text documents.

• Spreadsheet for Hadoop powered by BigSheets. BigSheets is a unique visualization and analysis tool designed to quickly build and publish charts and graphs for Big Data Applications.

We will have several demos. The demos will show you how you can store and analyze large volumes of current & historical social media and reference data. You'll see how raw datasets can be ingested and analyzed in real time. This talk and demo will provide an introduction to Text-Analytics and BigSheets, and how it is used within the IBM Big Data platform.

This Meetup is FREE. Food and Beverages will also be provided.

Agenda:6:00 – 6:30 PM – Registration

6:30 – 7:45 PM – Overview of IBM Big Data Platform and Accelerator for Social Data Analytics

7:45 – 8:00 PM – Demo of Election Analysis App on Mobile

8:00 – 8:15 PM – Break and Networking

Get a behind the scenes tour

8:00 – 8:15 PM – Text Analytics using AQL

8:15 – 8:30 PM – Visualize Data using BigSheets

8:30 – 8:45 PM – Q&A
name: Social Text-Analytics and Visualization using Hadoop & Streams Computing

description:
We will discuss the various SQL on Hadoop alternatives and explore why such technologies have become an area of keen interest for many organizations. We will discuss the various alternatives (Drill, Impala, Hive, Hadapt, Tajo, Shark, HAWQ, Presto, Phoenix, Big SQL) and their pros/cons. We will share customer use cases for Warehouse Modernization and the role of SQL for Hadoop in this space, as well as discuss performance characteristics of SQL on Hadoop when running common query workloads. We will provide an intro to Big SQL and demo. Big SQL delivers some exciting capabilities including comprehensive SQL functionality that leverages advanced SQL compiler/runtime all with low latency and high performance.

This will be a hands on event. Please download the BigInsights Hadoop distribution to get hands on with Big SQL.

Learn more about Big SQL here. Check out new SQL on Hadoop white paper.

Lunch will be provided at the end of the event. Please keep you RSVP updates so we can order the right amount of food.

In order to provide IBM building security with a full list of attendees, please respond to the RSVP questions. Thank you for your cooperation.
name: A Leap Forward for SQL on Hadoop

description:
You are invited to the first Chicago PaaS, Bluemix and Cloud Computing Meetup! In this session, we'll have a live demo and hands-on workshop of Liberty for Java on Bluemix. Bluemix is IBM’s open cloud platform intended to facilitate rapid development of applications in the cloud.

Whether you are a born-on-the-web and mobile developer, a startup/entrepreneur, an independent software vendor looking to make services available in the cloud, or just want to experiment with different technologies, this workshop will introduce you to a single solution environment that lets you develop, deploy and manage apps of all types (web, mobile, big data, new smart devices) across multiple domains.

This will be an interactive event where you will have a chance to play with Liberty for Java on Bluemix. Plan to bring your own laptop, but we will have some available for use as well. To use Bluemix during the meetup, you can register in advance for an IBM id and Bluemix account at www.Bluemix.net.

Also, dinner will be provided!

description:
Let's Get Hands-on: 60 minutes in Bluemix cloud - Predictive analytics made easy

Join us on Tuesday, August 12th in Foster City for our next Meetup. This joint Meetup between the Big Data Developers Meetup and the Bay Area Paas, Cloud Foundry & BlueMix Meetup will focus on predictive analytics in the cloud. Not in the Bay Area? Don't worry, we will be live streaming! Watch here

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6gvNOg46wKU

The Meetup kicks off at 6:00pm with food and beverages. Bring your laptop because after a short presentation, our developers will help you get hands-on with an In-database R capability in the cloud.

Predictive analytics can be applied to many areas including business-to-business (B2B) and business-to-consumer (B2C) areas, such as customer acquisition, retention, and winback. These analytics can be applied to technical tasks, such as predictive maintenance.

Using IBM Bluemix, an open-standards, cloud-based developer platform for building, managing and running apps, we will discuss how can we leverage analytics service in the cloud to provide the statistical analysis capability of R by using sample data sets that are stored in the BLU Acceleration for Cloud database.

In cases where predictive analytics needs to be applied to data sets that are much too large to fit into main memory, you can use in-database methods to analyze the data. This category contains the scalable variant of the Server Memory Usage sample, and it takes only a fraction of the runtime and memory.

Come learn hands on, how to use In-database R capability in the cloud. You will also learn to pump-in NOSQL document datasets into the warehouse for predictive analytics.

Agenda

6:00pm: Networking/Food & Beverages

6:30pm: Kickoff, Presentation & Demo

7:15pm: Cloud setup and prep

7:30pm: Get hands-on!

If you plan to participate in the hands-on session, please bring your laptop. Get a head start by registering on Bluemix.net and bring your Email ID to the Meetup.
name: Let's Get Hands-on: 60 minutes in the cloud - Predictive analytics made easy

description:
Big Data represents a new era in data exploration and utilization, and Hadoop offers an inexpensive, highly scalable solution for tackling the ever-increasing volumes and varieties of data. However, performing detailed reporting and analysis against data stored in Hadoop can be challenging. In order to provide an easy on-ramp for querying data managed by Hadoop, developers can now use standard SQL syntax to exploit Hadoop-based technologies. Right now, users have an excellent opportunity to jump into the world of Big Data with the introduction of SQL on Hadoop.

Please join us on Wednesday, August 20, at 6:00 PM for the next Philadelphia Big Data Developers Meetup, where IBM Big Data Architect Scott Gray will discuss how you can achieve unmatched simplicity, performance and security using SQL on Hadoop.

Following the session, please join us for hors d’evours and cocktails, where you will have the opportunity to network with others from IBM and the Big Data community. Location to follow shortly.
name: SQL on Hadoop

description:
R is a powerful Open Source programming language and software environment that enables deep statistical analysis of data, and graphical representation of the results. Key features include data exploration, statistical analysis, modeling, machine learning, simulations, and visualization of the results.

But, R's full potential is limited by process memory utilization and its inability to take advantage of parallel platforms, such as HADOOP, diminishing its ability to analyze very large data sets. IBM's Big-R offering extends IBM’s Big Data & Analytics tool-set with a highly-scalable & massively parallel execution of R on HADOOP. These capabilities enable data scientists to focus on the statistical analysis of large data sets, without being concerned with the underlying infrastructure.

This session will provide an overview of R, a description of IBM's Big-R, and a DEMO of the capabilities of Big-R.

Pizza, Salad, Networking: 6:30-7:00Meeting Start: 7:00
name: A Detailed Look at Big R: R + IBM InfoSphere BigInsights (Hadoop)

Join us and participate in an exclusive Big Data Developer Day hosted by the IBM Big Data team.

Open source Apache Hadoop is a great framework for distributed processing of large data sets. But there’s a difference between "playing" with big data versus solving real problems. The reality is that Hadoop alone might not be enough. Experience IBM’s enterprise-class Hadoop product, InfoSphere BigInsights, which enhances open source Hadoop with required enterprise capabilities including: analytics, visualization, security, standard SQL, enterprise HBase, developer/admin tools, learn about the role of Big Data in Motion, Big Data Exploration and more. The morning session will include interactive Big Data use case discussions, an overview of what is big data, live demonstrations of key Big Data components (Big Data at Rest, Big Data in Motion).

In the afternoon, get hands-on with Big Data using InfoSphere BigInsights Quick Start Edition and InfoSphere Streams Quick Start Edition with guidance from development experts. This is a unique opportunity to develop skills and learn about exciting technologies and techniques that you can immediately take back to your organization.

This event is FREE. Breakfast, Lunch and snacks will be provided.

description:
Discutiremos las diferentes alternativas de SQL en Hadoop y exploraremos por qué esas tecnologías se han convertido en un área de alta relevancia para muchas organizaciones. Se abordarán las alternativas (Drill, Impala, Hive, Hadapt, Tajo, Shark, HAWQ, Presto, Phoenix y BigSQL) y sus pros y contras. Compartiremos casos de clientes para Modernización de Warehouse y el rol de SQL para Hadoop en esta área, así como las características de desempeño de SQL en Hadoop cuando se corren queries de cargas de trabajo comunes.

También escucharemos del equipo de IBM cuáles son los retos técnicos cuando se desarrollan soluciones de SQL en Hadoop, cómo se resolvieron esos retos y cuáles son el siguiente conjunto de situaciones a enfrentar en la evolución de SQL en Hadoop. Se proveerá una introducción a Big SQL y una demo. IBM Big SQL entrega muchas capacidades muy interesantes incluyendo funcionalidad completa de SQL que toma ventaja del compilador/runtime avanzado de SQL con baja latencia y alto desempeño.

Aprenda más de Big SQL aquí. Lea el nuevo white paper de SQL en Hadoop.

Pruebe Big SQL por Usted mismo, ya sea en la nube o en una VM.

description:

Summary:

Learn how real-time processing of structured, semi-structured and unstructured data is done using a modern streaming engine (in this case IBM InfoSphere Streams) but the concepts you will learn are also applicable to Apache Storm or Spark Streaming

Highlights:

- Data at Rest vs. Data in Motion

- Operations on Streams, Windowing, Punctuations

- Sort, Filter, Aggregate, Merge, Join, Spit Data

- Extend Engine with Java Operators

- Extend Engine with C/C++ Operators

Description:

This course is designed to teach you about the Streams Processing Language. It will begin with the basic concepts of InfoSphere Streams and the basic Streams Processing Language operators used in a Streams program. You will learn how to access data from an external source using the Source type operators and write an output stream using the Sink type operators. You will then learn how and when to use the various Stream operators, like the Functor, Punctor, Aggregation, Sort, Join, Split, Barrier, Delay, and Switch operators. Lab exercise demonstrations will use the InfoSphere Streams IDE that is based upon Eclipse as the development and testing environment, but you will get the opportunity to see the invocation of the compilation of a Streams program from the command line as well.

description:
R is a powerful Open Source programming language and software environment that enables deep statistical analysis of data, and graphical representation of the results. Key features include data exploration, statistical analysis, modeling, machine learning, simulations, and visualization of the results.

But, R's full potential is limited by process memory utilization and its inability to take advantage of parallel platforms, such as HADOOP, diminishing its ability to analyze very large data sets. Using R on Hadoop breaks all this limits. These capabilities enable data scientists to focus on the statistical analysis of large data sets, without being concerned with the underlying infrastructure.

This session will provide an overview of R, comparison of Hadoop distributives with R-ability and live demo of the capabilities of R on Hadoop.
name: A Detailed Look at R on Hadoop

description:
Yes, we are back after the August summer break. Once again, we have access to Shoreditch Village Hall so we can return to this excellent venue for the September meetup.

The next meetup includes a talk by Cloudant on using this database with Bluemix, and a talk on the development environment that forms part of Bluemix (called IBM DevOps Services).

More details

Building apps with Cloudant and BlueMix (Simon Metson)

Cloudant is a NoSQL database provided as a service (DBaaS). It's the perfect partner for data rich BlueMix applications; enabling you to easily store, analyse and search your data without the worry of scaling issues or the "app store effect". The talk will look at the "aaS" landscape, what you can do with Cloudant and how integrating Cloudant and BlueMix can really supercharge your applications.

Simon Metson is the Product Director, Cloudant (anIBM® company). When asked to introduce himself, he said:

"I’m Simon Metson, a lapsed particle physicist, a product director at Cloudant (now an IBM® company), and a project committer on Apache CouchDB. For 10 years I worked on the distributed computing system for one of the Large Hadron Collider experiments, dealing with petabytes of relational and non-relational data. I'm now a product director at Cloudant, since joining in March 2012, focussing on making our service run smoothly and scale massively"

IBM DevOps Services - not just code (Anthony Kesterton)

IBM DevOps Services is a planning and development environment for IBM BlueMix, and other technologies. I will show you how to use IDS as well as explain how we used the system to manage a small but very distributed project (the rollout of a new tool at a large bank).

Anthony Kesterton is a technical specialist at IBM, and co-organiser of the London Bluemix meetup group.

Try IBM Bluemix

Feel free to bring along a tablet or laptop if you want to try out IBM Bluemix on the evening. You can sign up for an account on IBM Bluemix immediately, and start building the next killer app while munching on the snacks we provide at the meetup.

description:
The Pivotal Cloud Platform Roadshow is coming to Boston. The roadshow dovetails with Pivotal’s major announcement introducing comprehensive mobile services and the general availability of new data and ecosystem services for Pivotal CF, the world’s leading platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) for enterprises. The Pivotal CF enhancements in conjunction with the roadshow aim to meet the growing demand from enterprises for this mobile-first, cloud-first, and developer-first platform from which they can build and deploy great applications.

The full-day workshops will allow developers to get a comprehensive overview and chance to test drive Pivotal CF. Sessions will enable developers, operators, and service brokers to stage and push transformative software, bind and scale applications, deploy build packs and microservices, and drive continuous development from a fast, automated, cost-effective platform.

This is a unique opportunity to meet with technical leaders behind Pivotal CF, and to rediscover the transformative power software development in the enterprise.

description:
Join us on Thursday, September 18th in Foster City for our next Meetup.

The Meetup kicks off at 6:30pm with food and beverages. Bring your laptop because after a short presentation, our developers will help you get hands-on using Cloudant's DBMS-as-a-Service offering as an operational database.

Today’s applications are expected to manage a variety of structured and unstructured data, accessed by massive networks of users, devices, and business locations, or even sensors, vehicles and Internet-enabled goods. The Cloudant database as a service (DBaaS) is the first data management platform to leverage the availability, elasticity, and reach of the cloud to create a global data delivery network (DDN) that enables applications to scale larger and remain available to users wherever they are. Using IBM Bluemix, an open-standards, cloud-based developer platform for building, managing and running apps, we will discuss how can we leverage data management service in the cloud to provide the DBMS-as-a-Service offering as an operational database in support events published on IBM's IoT cloud.

Agenda

7:00pm: Kickoff, Presentation & Demo

7:30pm: Cloud setup and prep

7:45pm: Get hands-on!

If you plan to participate in the hands-on session, please bring your laptop. Get a head start by registering on Bluemix.net and Cloudant (https://cloudant.com/sign-up/)and bring your Email ID to the Meetup.

Hadoop has extended the analysis of large data sets beyond that of traditional Data Warehouses. But as IT professionals begin to migrate traditional BI/DW services (e.g., OLAP, ROLAP, Ad-Hoc, etc.) to the Hadoop environment, they are presented with a challenge regarding how best to integrate traditional BI tools with their Hadoop environment.

This session will discuss Hadoop in general, and then we will explore the use SQL to access data persisted in the HDFS. Next, we will take a detailed look at "BigSQL" & "BigSheets" -- two tools that are bundled with IBM's Hadoop offering, known as "BigInsights." Each overview session will follow with a demonstration of the technology.

This event is free and lunch will be provided.

name: Getting started with SQL on Hadoop

description:
In this meetup you are invited to have some pasta with us and hear something about the latest developments in the SQL on Hadoop, R on Hadoop and Analytics on Realtime Streams - and of course, how this all applies to cloud computing.

We keep this rather informal and in case somebody want to present something please let me know and I can update the agenda.

I'll also promise that this is not a marketing event, I'm a tekki but I'll explain some concept using IBM products. As these are all based on open standards the concepts also hold on open source and competition products.

This is a draft agenda:

1. SQL on Hadoop

Different types of SQL to MapReduce compilers and also SQL Engines bringing their own Execution Environment. This talk concludes with a IBM BigSQL Ansi 2003/DB2 complient SQL engine demo.

2. R on Hadoop

Summary on R on Hadoop projects. Basic reference architecture for pushing R code down to the Hadoop engine. Demo of IBM BigR and IBM SystemML

3. Stream Computing Overview and Demo. Learn the basic concepts about Stream Computing (e.g. working on sliding windows of different types, working with different operaations on Data Streams: Sink, Source, Aggregate, Join, Punctuate, Throttle, ..). Demo of IBM InfoSphere Streams.

4. PaaS and DBaaS: Learn how to apply the methods learned in a Platform as a Service Cloud. Cloudfoundry and IBM Bluemix Demo
name: SQL on Hadoop, R on Hadoop, Streaming Analytics, Cloud (Cloudfoundry) & Pasta

description:
Sign in at the security desk (you will need photo ID) and take the elevator to the 12th floor, room 1219.

Agenda

6pm - 6:30pm: Pre-meeting conversation, networking, light refreshments6:30pm - 8pm: Presentation, demos, Q&A8pm onward: Optionally reconvene at a local watering hole for post-meeting conversation and networking.

Abstract

At this joint NYC Cloud Foundry and NY PHP meetup, we'll discuss the shift to Platform-as-a-Service and what it means for PHP development on the cloud.

First, we'll take a look at the "traditional" cloud Infrastructure-as-a-Service (virtual servers and disks) model and describe how Platform-as-a-Service builds upon it to provide the runtimes and data services for hosting PHP applications.

We'll then demonstrate how a PHP developer can use buildpacks and services within a Cloud Foundry PaaS to deploy scalable and resilient apps to his or her cloud of choice.

Along the way we'll compare the variety of buildpacks available to PHP developers, show techniques for binding to services, and highlight best practices for creating born-on-the-cloud apps based on a microservices architecture.

Speaker bio

Daniel Krook is an IBM Senior Certified IT Specialist and Master Inventor. He's also a proud Zend Certified Engineer and writes about PHP integration with IBM software for developerWorks and Redbooks. Daniel has run monthly New York PHP user group meetings since 2004 and established the NYC Cloud Foundry meetup in 2013. He currently delivers IBM Bluemix innovation based on the OpenStack and Cloud Foundry open source projects.
name: Cloud Foundry for PHP Developers (Joint event with NYPHP)

description:
# Scale-up vs. Scale-out, how massive parallel multicore systems are shaping the BigData ecosystem

Hadoop workloads today rely on commodity x86 infrastructure, which although having cheaper costs, also provide lower reliability than UNIX Servers. IBM, through its proprietary POWER Architecture, wants to provide an alternative, aimed at achieving a higher performance at comparable prices. We will discuss IBM's Hadoop Reference Architecture, its performance, and the technical features of the POWER Chip, that enable Hadoop workloads to run faster, and achieve higher throughput per core.

# On-Premise vs. Cloud: Free or highly competitive (BigData) data management solutions in the cloud: Column Stores, Document Stores, Hadoop

- Brief Introduction to MongoDB incl. Live - Demo

- Brief Introduction to CouchDB incl. Live - Demo of Cloudant - App deployed to Bluemix

- Intro to DB2 and DB2 BLU vectorized column processing

- Intro to MySQL as a Service

- Intro to PostgreSQL as a Service

- Intro to Cloudera as a Service

- Intro to Cassandra as a Service
name: Hardware Deep Dive for BigData Processing, BigData in the Cloud

Join us for a Big Data Developer Day - SQL on Hadoop. This event is co-sponsored by Concord, an IBM Premiere Business Partner and the Big Data Developer Team.

In order to CONFIRM your seat at this event, you must register through the link here:

http://ibm.co/1qADVX1

We will discuss the various SQL on Hadoop alternatives and explore why such technologies have become an area of keen interest for many organizations. We will discuss the various alternatives (Drill, Impala, Hive, Hadapt, Tajo, Shark, HAWQ, Presto, Phoenix, Big SQL) and their pros/cons. We will share customer use cases for Warehouse Modernization and the role of SQL for Hadoop in this space, as well as discuss performance characteristics of SQL on Hadoop when running common query workloads. We will provide an intro to Big SQL and demo. Big SQL delivers some exciting capabilities including comprehensive SQL functionality that leverages advanced SQL compiler/runtime all with low latency and high performance.

This will be a hands on event. Please download the BigInsights Hadoop distribution to get hands on with Big SQL.

Learn more about Big SQL here. Check out new SQL on Hadoop white paper.

Breakfast and lunch will be provided at the event.

description:
The introduction of Big Data and Hadoop has resulted in a paradigm shift in the field of data analytics. New analytics opportunities also bring new challenges: analyzing unstructured data, exploiting social media, making fast decisions on massive data volumes and more. R is a flexible programming language designed to facilitate predictive data analysis, but unlocking the value of Big Data with R can be complex. Businesses are looking for ways to remove this complexity, and combine unstructured or semi-structured data for improved predictions and optimal performance.

Join us on October 7, 2014 as we explore ways to make predictive analytics with R more accessible to business users and discuss the solutions needed to capitalize on the promise of Big Data.

Following the session, please join us for beverages and hors d’evours, where you will have the opportunity to network with others from IBM and the Big Data community.
name: Big Data Analytics with R (registration now closed)

Open source Apache Hadoop is a great framework for distributed processing of large data sets. But there’s a difference between "playing" with big data versus solving real problems. The reality is that Hadoop alone might not be enough. Experience IBM’s enterprise-class Hadoop product, InfoSphere BigInsights, which enhances open source Hadoop with required enterprise capabilities including: analytics, visualization, security, standard SQL, enterprise HBase, developer/admin tools, Big Data Exploration and more. The morning session will include interactive Big Data use case discussions, an overview of what is big data, live demonstrations of key Big Data and Analytic components.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=B27SpLOOhWw

In the afternoon, get hands-on with Big Data using InfoSphere BigInsights Quick Start Edition, with guidance from development experts. This is a unique opportunity to develop skills and learn about exciting technologies and techniques that you can immediately take back to your organization.

This event is FREE. Breakfast, Lunch and snacks will be provided.

Agenda (subject to change)

9:00 am to 9:30 am - Breakfast, Registration and Introductions

9:30 am to 10:30 am - Welcome and Keynote - Big Data Overview

10:30 am to 11:30 am - Adding Value to your Organization Beyond Hadoop: An Enterprise View of Big Data

11:30 am to 12:30 pm - Analytics for Everyone: Addressing the Analytic needs of the Enterprise

12:30 pm to 1:30 pm - Lunch

-- Demo Overview of BlueMix during Lunch

OR

1:30 pm to 5:00 pm - Lab 2 - Analytics Hands-on Lab (Limited number of machines will be available)

5:00 PM Close Thank You for Attending

Labs will use BigInsights Quickstart VM. Here is a video on how to setup the BigInsights Quickstart VM. To learn more before hand and get hands on go to Big Data University.

Seating is limited. Please register at this URL in order to confirm your seat.

http://ibm.co/1nncMSG

Thanks and we look forward to seeing you at the event.

description:
IBM® Cloudant™ database service delivers high availability, elastic scalability and innovative mobile device synchronization. The Cloudant JSON cloud-based data service allows mobile and web developers to quickly and easily store and access the rapidly increasing amount of mobile data using an application programming interface (API) that is significantly easier to use than alternatives. Increasingly, developers have embraced NoSQL databases because of their flexibility, and JSON has become thepredominant NoSQL database technology for mobile and web app developers. This session consists of both presentations and hands-on lab exercises.

This session introduces Cloudant and how it differs from other data management platforms. Key features are described, including Cloudant Query, MapReduce and integrated Lucene Search along with RESTful HTTP API.

Agenda

• NoSQL landscape

• Database as a service

• JSON primer

• Cloudant dashboard

• Replication

• RESTful APIs

• Primary indexes

• Cloudant query

• Secondary indexes or MapReduce

• Search indexes Accessing Cloudant from an application

This event is free. Complimentary refreshments including continental breakfast and lunch will be provided. For your convenience, registration and continental breakfast begins at 8:30 a.m. The session starts at 9:00 a.m. and ends at approximately 5:00 p.m.

To guarantee your seat, register here and receive a confirmation.
name: A Technical Introduction to Cloudant : A JSON Data Layer in the Cloud

description:
3rd Floor Room: Sienna C

PLEASE NOTE TO CHANGE IN TIME FOR THIS SESSION

R is a popular programming language and environment for data science. This Meetup introduces Big R, the end-to-end integration of R into Hadoop using IBM BigInsights (aka IBM's hadoop distribution). Big R allows R users to seamlessly access and manipulate data in HDFS using R's familiar programming syntax and paradigm. In this Meetup, you'll learn how to perform tasks such as data exploration, transformation, statistical analysis, modeling, and visualization at scale without resorting to map/reduce constructs or unfamiliar scripting languages. For machine learning tasks such as regression, classification, or clustering over extremely large data sets, this Meetup will also demonstrate an upcoming technology in Big R to run scalable machine learning algorithms. We will also show a demo of connecting and running R jobs on Hadoop and provide you pointers on how to get started.
name: Data Science using Big R for in-Hadoop Analytics
group_name: Big Data Developers in Las Vegas

description:
3rd Floor Room: Sienna C

Big SQL opened Hadoop data to SQL access, relational database optimizations and runtime performance. The next version of Big SQL represents a quantum leap in SQL support and performance, by applying decades of IBM research in optimization and query runtime technology toward the efficient execution of SQL on Hadoop.

In this presentation, you learn about the architecture of this next generation Big SQL offering and key performance aspects. You also learn how it enables traditional warehouse style applications to run on Hadoop data and clusters.

How fast is your SQL on Hadoop? Check out this paper on SQL on Hadoop Benchmarking

Get started with the fasted SQL on Hadoop.
name: Big SQL 3.0: SQL on Hadoop without Compromise

description:
The IBM Rochester Technical Vitality Council invites you to attend a special hands on 1.5 hour Meetup on October 29, 2014 from 4:00 to 5:30 pm at RCTC in room East Hall 119 (EA 119). The topic for this Meetup will be: Cloud and Mobile Application Development using IBM's Bluemix cloud platform. This is not a sales meeting. Instead, IBM would like to make Bluemix available to as many technical developers as possible, free of charge. We would also like to provide an opportunity for technical developers in the Rochester area to collaborate and interact around this new service. There may be some time at the end to do some coding, so bring your laptop. Also, it will make things easier if you sign up for Bluemix prior to the Meetup at https://ace.ng.bluemix.net/

What is BlueMix, exactly?

Bluemix is an open-standards, cloud-based platform for building, managing and running apps of all types (web, mobile, big data, new smart devices). Capabilities include support for multiple programming languages and runtimes including Java and Node.js, mobile backend development, application monitoring, as well as capabilities from ecosystem partners and open source — all through an as-a-service model in the cloud. To find out more information, go to the Bluemix website at https://ace.ng.bluemix.net/.

Hopefully you will want to join us for this exciting opportunity to "Meetup" with technical IBMers and other technical people in Rochester. We look forward to meeting with you soon.

.
name: Learn about IBM's new free cloud development platform, BlueMix

Abstract

Alright, so maybe "bootiful" won't ever work, but I tried, and it was worth it too because you're reading this.

Spring Boot, the new convention-over-configuration centric framework from the Spring team at Pivotal, marries Spring's flexibility with conventional, common sense defaults to make application development not just fly, but pleasant! The recently announced Spring Cloud projects sits Spring Boot on top of the Netflix OSS stack, giving you "bootiful" primitives for building microservice-style architectures.

Join Spring developer advocate Josh Long for a look at what Spring Boot and Spring Cloud are, why they're turning heads and how they, along with Cloud Foundry, provide a first-class platform and approach to modern application development.

Speaker

Josh Long is a Spring developer advocate at Pivotal.

Hadoop and Cloud is an almost perfect marriage. Hadoop is a distributed computing framework that leverages a cluster built on commodity hardware. The Cloud simplifies provisioning of machines and software. Getting started with Hadoop on the Cloud makes it simple to provision your environment quickly and actually get started using Hadoop. IBM Bluemix has democratized Hadoop for the masses!

This session will provide a brief introduction to what Hadoop is, how does cloud work and will then focus on how to get started.

Want to get started now? Try these tutorials:

Analytics for Hadoop Service

HDFS IoT Recipe

description:
One of the sources of Big Data are IoT and Wearable technology applications. For example, the Kiwi device collects 50 measurements per second. Participate in this meetup to learn how you can collect data from wearables and analyze them.

This meetup has been created to support SportsHack 2014 (sportshackweekend.org) the very first wearable tech hack specific to Sports in Toronto. It's a great chance to network and potentially form teams for the hack which will happen on Nov 14 - 16, 2014. If you will not be participating in the Hack, you are still invited!

Remember to register and use the 30 day Bluemix free trial.

Agenda:

5:00pm - Network / Optionally form teams for SportsHack, hands-on with wearables

6:30pm - Technical presentation about wearables to be used on the SportsHack

7:00pm - Network / Optionally form teams for SportsHack, hands-on with wearables

10:00pm - End of event

Bring your laptops if you want to play with the wearables, and bring any wearable you may want to use in the SportsHack. There will be Internet connectivity.

Four stations will be set up in this meetup:

Station #1: Muse (InteraXon)

Station #2: Myo (Thalmic Labs)

Station #3: Kiwi Device (Kiwi Wearables)

Station #4: Other wearables and devices that can complement a solution with wearables (Oculus Rift, bring your own!, Freescale devices)

Each station will have a number of wearable devices to try, and where you'll have a chance to write code using the wearable 's SDK (first come, first served). There will be mentors at each station that can help you speed up your learning process, and they can also demo apps they've written. Feel free to arrive at any time between 5pm and 10pm. You can rotate between stations. In order to give a chance to everyone to play with the devices, the organizers may limit the time participants have per station.

Join us and have fun!

Refreshments / snacks will be provided

Brought to you by:

Thanks to the DMZ (Ryerson University) for providing the venue and helping with logistics for this event
name: Hands-on: Develop with wearable technology and analyze big data

description:
IBM is hosting a Big Data and Analytics Day on November 5th at the Austin IBM Innovation Center. This is a great opportunity to learn more about IBM's Big Data and Analytics. Join us for a hands-on technical session to learn all about the key capabilities in the IBM Big Data and Analytics portfolio. We will also feature Watson Analytics, how to get started via our Cloud-based Bluemix tools, and how these offerings can solve real business problems. All of these key capabilities are illustrated via a real life Internet of Things application which was developed especially for this event. The IBM Big Data & Analytics Day is offered as two half day sessions: Essentials overview and demo is targeted at business types and executives, and the Hands-on Workshop is the key component for IBM Big Data & Analytics Day designed with developers as the target audience. These events are tailored for developers and business leaders to understand the value and essentials of the IBM Big Data & Analytics portfolio. Through demonstrations and hands-on labs you will see the Architecture of the Solution, Open Cloud environment with IBM Bluemix, Connected devices, Utilization of Cloudant DBaaS, Hadoop and MapReduce, Building the Analytics layer with SPSS and R. 1. Sign up for Big Data & Analytics Essentials here: http://www-304.ibm.com/events/idr/idrevents/detail.action?meid=19137&ieid=12199&cmp=pw&cpb=pw&ct=pwrss&cr=pwiic&ccy=zz

2. Sign up for Big Data & Analytics Hands-on Workshop here: http://www-304.ibm.com/events/idr/idrevents/detail.action?meid=19137&ieid=12386&cmp=pw&cpb=pw&ct=pwrss&cr=pwiic&ccy=zz
name: Big Data and Analytics Day

description:
Format is a business and value proposition overview followed by a technical overview, all centered around a demonstration to cover key capabilities as well as Watson Analytic.

Duration: 3 hours

Agenda

Introduction - The Path to New Value with IBM Big Data & Analytics Connecting our Bodies to the CloudDemonstration - Avert Critical Health Conditions Real-time streaming data combining the Internet of things with a connected device streaming data via a smartphone to the cloud to store data and perform analytical operations and analysis

Demo breakdown high-level overview

The Big Data Analytics Value Proposition

The Big Data Market §Industry Use Cases Into the future with Big Data Analytics
name: Big Data and Analytics Essentials

description:
IBM Watson, Building on Innovation

Wednesday, November 5,[masked]:00 PM to 8:30 PM Palo Alto , CA">

Perkins Coie

3150 Porter Drive Palo Alto , Palo Alto , CA (map)

*Name, Company, & Email Required For Entry When You RSVP*

In 2011, IBM Watson heralded the next 50-year wave of innovation in computing by winning the game show Jeopardy and ushering in the age of cognitive computing. Today, we have released a raft of cognitive services on bluemix.net, and we're partnering with (and in some cases funding) startups that build cognitive applications. I'll break down the core capabilities — what Watson can and can't do today and on our immediate roadmap — so that teams can know with some precision what they can do with Watson now.

Meet the speaker:

John Wolpert, Product Line Manager and Evangelist, Watson Ecosystem at IBM Watson Group

John Wolpert leads product development for the Watson Ecosystem, with responsibility for setting the development roadmap, curating and ensuring the quality of available services, and keeping the organization focused sharply on the user. He also crafts and tells the Watson story to partners, leaders and audiences world-wide, using that regular contact with people outside IBM to gain insights for innovating and improving the end-to-end Ecosystem experience. He works out of the IBM Bluemix Garage incubator in San Francisco, where he has access to dozens of startups every day.

John is a three-time entrepreneur and founder of the popular Taxi App, Flywheel. He has created new lines of business for several Fortune 100 companies, ran an international consortium of research labs, and has been an IBMer three times — in the past running the ground-breaking alphaWorks organization and the Extreme Blue incubator lab, one of the most patented labs in IBM history. John has taught Lean Startup practices at UC Berkeley, and his work on collaborative business model innovation is published in Harvard Business Review and Harvard Business School Press. He has delivered keynotes to the Australian Parliament, the European Commission, and for numerous corporate and top industry events.

Agenda[masked]pm: Registration & Networking6:[masked]pm: Introductions7:00-7:45pm: Tech Talk7:[masked]pm: Q&A session

name: Big Data Analytics in Detail

description:
InfoSphere BigInsights is IBM's solution to leverage the power of Hadoop to manage a wide variety of structured, unstructured and semi-structured data. It augments open source Hadoop with enterprise capabilities such as: performance optimization, development tooling, analytic accelerators, visualization, security etc.

SAS High performance Analytics has different levels of Hadoop support within the BigInsights environment. BigInsights is used as a data-sourcing environment that allows you to utilize information in structures such as Hive.

Please JOIN us to hear about this integration capability and how SAS Analytics and IBM's hadoop distribution can facilitate load on servers, storage, network and provide a simplified management of analytic data.

This event is FREE. Dinner and Snacks will be provided.

Agenda

5:30 - 6:00 pm Registration/Dinner

6:00 - 6:10 pm Quick Introduction to BigInsights

6:10 - 6:45 pm BigInsights integration with SAS

- Technology Overview

- SAS Analytics Components

- SAS Architecture (In-memory & In-database)

- BigInsights leveraging SAS

- Processing

- Similarities & Differences

6:45 - 7:15 pm Integration Demo

7:15 - 7:30 pm Questions/Next Steps

Please RSVP. Seats are limited.

Address: 3039 East Cornwallis Rd., Durham, NC 27709

Directions

1) Take I-40 West and take the Davis Dr. Exit #280. Turn right at the ramp.

3) Go 1.2 miles on Davis Drive to stoplight at Cornwallis Rd.

4) Go straight and enter IBM property through the Main Gate Visitor Entrance.

5) Inform security you are going to B002 Main Lobby.6) Follow signs to Executive Briefing Centers and park at B002 visitor lot.

description:
Welcome to our second RTP Bluemix meetup !

This meetup is the kickoff & teaming event for the IoT Design Challenge, sponsored by IBM and The Research Triangle Park to learn how to use the rapid application design tool to build IoT application, and form a team to compete for the grand prizes. You can find out more details about the challenges here.

The meetup will be held on Friday, November 7th, 4:00pm - 6:30pm at the IBM Building 500, 4205 S. Miami Blvd, Research Triangle Park, NC.

Powering millions of devices across industries and geographies, the Internet of Things is transforming the way corporations and consumers interact with each other and the environment around them. The Internet of Things will change business models, technology investments, consumer experiences, and everyday life. Our Nov 7 meetup will focus on demonstration:

Agenda:

• Kick Off with Key Note - 15 mins

• Kyle Brown with Peter Xu - IoT Reference Architecture - 15 mins

• Michael Rowe - Demo (door opening) - 15 mins

• Mihir Shah with David Huffman - Health/other sensor Demo and where to go for IoT Resources - 15 mins

• Om Bachu with Lak - Mobile Sensors Demo and Resources (demo and ppt) - 15 mins

• Kris Vishwanathan - Examples / Customer IoT Case Studies - 15 mins

• John Douglas - Design Challenge Rules and Tips - 15 mins

The latest details for the Design Challenge, including prizes, times and locations, and answers to questions about creating teams, can be found in this IBM Developer Works Community

https://www.ibm.com/developerworks/community/groups/community/cloudmobilechallenge

Please join the community to be notified of updates as they are posted.
name: IoT Design Challenge Kick-Off

description:
Dear Big Data Enthusiast,

Join Mumbai Big Data Meetup on 8th November to learn the latest on Big Data and Analytics for cutting edge insight, business intelligence and ROI.

The meetup discussions will have specific focus on the financial sector that essentially thrives on data. Data analytics, infrastructure, process, technology and culture all need to be in place and working cohesively to maximize the return of big data and analytics.

We will discuss the latest on Big Data technology covering SQL on Hadoop, Business Intelligence, Streaming Analytics and explore why such technologies have become an area of keen interest for many organizations. We will share Industry use cases for Data Warehouse Modernization and the role of SQL for Hadoop in this space, as well as discuss performance characteristics of SQL on Hadoop when running common query workloads.

This is a FREE event and only requirement is to sign-up at above mentioned link to RSVP and stay connected with Mumbai Big Data community.

Additionally, you may invite your customers as well as post the enclosed event brochure at your customer locations too.

Venue: Don Bosco Institute of Technology, Opposite Kohinoor Mall, Kurla(W)

Time: 8th November, 2014 from 9.30 AM through 1.30 PM

Agenda:

9:00 am to 9:30 am Registration

9:30 am to 10:15 am Welcome and Keynote - Honourable Shri Kajal Ghose - SBI, Chief General Manager, Executive Support System

10:15 am to 11:30 am Overview of Big Data and SQL on Hadoop

11:30 am to 12:15 pm Big Data Platform Use Cases – Landing Zone, EDW Modernization, Big SQL and BI

12:15 am to 12:30 pm Tea Break

12:30 pm to 1:00 pm Streaming Data Analytics

1:00 pm to 1:30 PM Big Data Challenges for Financial Sector – Hands on Modelling and Demo Sessions

Enclosing a YouTube video of Mr Kajal Ghose, Chief General Manager, State Bank of India delivering a philanthropic talk to an audience during Samaavesh, a cultural evening organized to promote young talent from the slums of Delhi. He spoke highly about the work of Asha and the longstanding relationship between S.B.I. and Asha.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cxxzeBef7zI

Thank you for your support and I look forward meeting up with you soon.

Tushar Kale

Big Data Evangelist

name: Mumbai Big Data Meetup 4Q2014

description:
CALLING ALL DEVELOPERS .... JOIN THE BIG DATA FOR SOCIAL GOOD CHALLENGE

Big data exists in just about everything we use and do. It comes from phones, cars, roads, power lines, waterways, food crates, and innumerable other items you’d never think of as computers. This data speaks volumes about our collective behavior and society – so let’s use it to do something incredible! IBM invites developers and data enthusiasts to take a deep dive into real world civic issues using big data and the IBM Bluemix Analytics for Hadoop service. Analyze one of our curated datasets or bring your own (provided it meets these requirements)! Use Hadoop and your data to create a clickable and interactive data visualization to highlight insights that you’ve found.

Ready to get started? $40,000 in prizes will be awarded....

Register here:http://ibmhadoop.challengepost.com/

What to Create: Participants must create a working, clickable, and interactive data visualization utilizing the Analytics for Hadoop service on IBM Bluemix.

Data Requirements: Your data visualization must analyze one or more datasets included in the curated list of datasets on the Data page OR meet the data size, content, and licensing requirements described on the Data page. The total size of the Datasets analyzed must be between 500MB - 7GB in size.

Check out the requirements then go get your IBM Bluemix extended promo code and check out the datasets!

This data speaks volumes about our collective behavior and society – so let’s use it to do something incredible! IBM invites developers and data enthusiasts to take a deep dive into real world civic issues using big data and the IBM Bluemix Analytics for Hadoop service. Analyze one of our curated datasets or bring your own (provided it meets these requirements)! Use Hadoop and your data to create a clickable and interactive data visualization to highlight insights that you’ve found.

Ready to get started? $40,000 in prizes will be awarded....

Register here:http://ibmhadoop.challengepost.com/

What to Create: Participants must create a working, clickable, and interactive data visualization utilizing the Analytics for Hadoop service on IBM Bluemix.

Data Requirements: Your data visualization must analyze one or more datasets included in the curated list of datasets on the Data page OR meet the data size, content, and licensing requirements described on the Data page. The total size of the Datasets analyzed must be between 500MB - 7GB in size.

Check out the requirements then go get your IBM Bluemix extended promo code and check out the datasets!

description:
This is the second meetup created in support of SportsHack 2014 (sportshackweekend.org), the very first wearable tech hack specific to Sports in Toronto. In this meetup we will cover Bluemix in more detail, and show you how to get different wearable devices connected to several Bluemix services, including dashDB (Analytics warehouse), and Analytics for Hadoop. Bluemix is the required platform to use for SportsHack. For info on the first meetup in support of SportsHack 2014, check this link.

Remember to register and use the 30 day Bluemix free trial prior to attending this meetup. Bring your computer to work on the labs! - Internet access will be available.

Agenda

6:00pm - 6:15pm Welcome - Bluemix tour

6:15pm - 6:25pm IoT & NodeRed demo

6:25pm - 6:35pm IoT & NodeRed QuickLab

6:35pm - 6:45pm CF Tool

6:45pm - 6:55pm CF Tool Quicklab

6:55pm - 7:05pm DevOps services demo

7:05pm - 7:15pm DevOps services QuickLab

7:15pm - 7:20pm Using Bluemix Eclipse plug-in

7:20pm - 7:35pm Using dashDB/Analytics for Hadoop

7:35pm - 7:45pm Using dashDB QuickLab

7:45pm - 7:55pm Freescale to Bluemix demo

7:55pm - 8:05pm Muse to Bluemix demo

8:05pm - 8:15pm Muse to Bluemix Quicklab

8:15pm - 8:25pm Myo to Bluemix demo

8:25pm - 8:35pm Raspberry Pi to Bluemix demo

8:35pm - 8:45pm Kiwi to Bluemix demo

8:45pm - 8:55pm Kiwi to Bluemix QuickLab

Snacks/refreshments will be provided

Remember to register for your 30 day Bluemix free trial. (30 days begins the day you register.)
name: Hands-on: Bluemix Workshop - Wearables and Big Data on Bluemix

description:
Come join other developers as we learn to develop and deploy applications in the cloud using IBM's Bluemix PaaS. These sessions will be active coding sessions where the speaker will walk you through developing an application using Bluemix. If you know of other developers who are interested in learning how to develop in the cloud, please share the link to this group.

Refreshments:

Food and soft drinks to be provided by IBM.

Agenda:

• Meet and Greet

• Quick introduction to Bluemix from IBM Bluemix team.

• Main Talk: Details to come

Requirements:

• Bring your laptop since we will be actively coding.

• You must register to work with IBM Bluemix before the Meetup. Please register at the following site: https://ace.ng.bluemix.net/.

• For the development portion, please have the following installed before the meeting in order to save time. (Note: Each bullet entry is linked to the corresponding site.)

• Eclipse IDE for Java EE Developers

• Git

• CF Tool

Where to Go:

The meetings will be held at the Louisiana Technology Park on Florida Blvd. There is a large parking lot outside of the building. Please enter the building through the main entrance. If you arrive late, text Sean Marshall at[masked], and someone will let you in the side entrance.
name: Develop and Deploy Applications in the Cloud Using IBM Bluemix PaaS
