description:
Join us in New York City on April 14th for our NYC IBM Bluemix Meetup! We will have a speaker from the Bluemix Team and the Co-Founder/Chief Technology Officer, Tom Luczak, of flowthings.io speak about Internet of Things (IoT) capabilities on Bluemix and running their IoT platform on Softlayer. The Meetup kicks off with an opportunity for networking at 5:30pm with food and beverages.

Agenda5:30 pm: Networking/Food & Beverages

6:00 pm: Welcome and Announcements

6:05 pm: IoT on Bluemix, Peter Xu, Bluemix IoT Solution Sales Leader

7:30 pm: Break

7:40 pm: flowthings.io, Tom Luczak, Co-founder/CTO of flowthings.io

8:45 pm: Networking

9 pm: End of Meeting

If you do not have access to Bluemix or if your trial has expired, please sign up for a new trial of Bluemix before the meetup here: https://ibm.biz/NYC_Meetup

Speaker Bio

Peter Xu - Bluemix IoT Solution Sales Leader

Peter Xu is currently Bluemix IoT Solution Sales Leader at IBM Cloud unit. In this role, Peter works closely with electronics & appliance makers, auto OEMs & industrial manufacturers to assist them in defining IoT strategy and roadmap -- architecting cutting edge IoT solutions utilizing the latest cloud-based technologies such as MQTT, real-time streaming, voice, cognitive and analytics. Peter enjoys helping customers innovate with IoT & Bluemix. Prior to the current job, Peter had been in the IBM WebSphere middleware group for 15 years, holding various positions in consulting, technical sales and sales, which equipped him with deep technical skills in Java EE, Integration, SOA, BPM, API and Mobile technologies.

Tom Luczak - Co-Founder/Chief Technology Officer of flowthings.io

Tom’s love affair with all things computing, hardware, and communications began in the mid-80's. His passion growing while soldering upgrades into floppy drives and "enhancing" modems and phone lines to get better speed on his dial-up CompuServe connection.

What started as a passion grew into a career years later while serving in the U.S. Army as an Electronic Warfare and Signals Intelligence Specialist and Linguist. As a Technical Director at an overseas location, Tom specialized in multiple analytic disciplines and participated in the creation and evaluation of several national-level intelligence products. He also earned Adjunct Faculty status at the National Cryptologic School and both co-authored and taught highly technical courses in several subject areas, including analytics, reporting, astrodynamics, and advanced radio theory. In short, he had a geektastic time.

A couple of years later, (before most had heard the phrase "Internet of Things") Tom met Eric, and they decided to found a company called "Flow" with the vision of realtime data sharing between disparate systems in an agile way. Since that first meeting in a diner in Gramercy, Tom has loved every second of building the flowthings.io team and technology to realize that vision. He especially enjoys how his role lets him play with some neat hardware, get his hands dirty with a soldering iron, and constantly be amazed at the terminal effect a bunch of 1's and 0's flowing through the internet can have on the physical world.

In addition to his work on flowthings.io, Tom is the proud father of three smaller and better versions of himself and lives in Brooklyn with his wife and two dogs. He enjoys live music, complicated tabletop games, perforating paper from extreme distance and the study thereof, and making plans for the fully self-sustaining domicile he intends to build.
name: Internet of Things (IoT) on IBM Bluemix

description:
Registration will close April 16th. DON'T MISS THIS OPPORTUNITY TO LEARN ALL ABOUT THE NEW FEATURES AND FUNCTIONS OF BOTH BIG INSIGHTS AND STREAMS. REGISTER AT THE LINK BELOW IN ORDER TO CONFIRM YOUR SEAT.

http://ibm.co/1BScLjZ

Join us on April 16th at our Foster City IBM location for an exciting Big Data & Analytics Developer Day. Learn about new features and functions for both InfoSphere BigInsights and InfoSphere Streams. You will also be able to get hands-on lab experience with the technology, guided by our development experts.

To confirm your seat, you must register here: http://ibm.co/1BScLjZ

A growing number of organizations today recognize Apache Hadoop as a powerful technology for collecting and economically storing a very large set of highly variable data. There is a need to quickly find relevant information as well as making it easy for IT to manage and deploy for everyone to use. With the new release of BigInsights provides a broad data science toolset to query, visualize, and explore data and conduct distributed machine learning at scale.

With smart phones and fully instrumented cars, the amount of data we can collect from moving objects is growing at staggering rates. With Big Data volume comes Big Data challenges. The opportunity for applying all of this data in real-time to problems with transportation, congestion management, emergency response, microweather prediction, supply chain management and so on, is tremendous. With the new features and functions of IBM InfoSphere Streams, clients will be enabled to perform analytics on fast moving data at scale. InfoSphere Streams helps organizations achieve solid business outcomes, including increased business agility, higher application resiliency and more efficient IT operations, spanning IT administrators and developers.

Agenda for the day (subject to change):

09:00 am - Registration/Breakfast/Networking09:30 am - Keynote and Overview: InfoSphere BigInsights10:30 am - Demo - Deep Dive of InfoSphere BigInsights11:00 am - Keynote and Overview: InfoSphere Streams12:00 pm - Demo - Deep Dive of InfoSphere Streams12:30 pm - Lunch and demo of new features01:30 pm - Hands-on Labs (pls. bring your own laptop) * BlueMix Hands-on Lab * InfoSphere Streams Hands-on Lab - basic/advanced * InfoSphere BigInsights Hands-on Lab05:00 pm - Close and Thank You for Attending

Please register at

http://ibm.co/1BScLjZ

in order to confirm your seat and receive pre-event download requirements.

We look forward to seeing you there.

This week's speaker/instructors:

Peter Jongsma works with cloud computing, from on-premise private clouds, to public clouds, to IaaS and PaaS and hybrid cloud environments optimized for data and security. He works to automate and improve the productivity of software developers as they bring applications through the software development life cycle, and helps their operations staffs to provide cloud management for their IT services, allowing them to accelerate the delivery of software and infrastructure.

Umang Shah uses continuous delivery and testing through the use of agile and lean software development, software deployment automation and automated testing taking advantage of DevOps and Cloud technologies. He works to increase the velocity of software deployment through automation incorporating open standards and technologies.

Can't find the time to get your hands dirty with Bluemix and SoftLayer? Here's the chance to come down for an introductory hands-on workshop session with our Bluemix and SoftLayer experts and start developing with Bluemix and SoftLayer.

Note: This is a "Bring your own Laptop" workshop.

Take the opportunity to build and deploy applications and services in a matter of hours on Bluemix (built on SoftLayer)!

As part of this workshop you will be able to:

• Learn the fundamentals of building and deploying your application in the Cloud• Work with Bluemix experts on how to use the product and build your application

Build your own simple application or use our sample labs and learn how to build and deploy on Bluemix and SoftLayer.

If you have experience with Mesos, please let me know. Looking for a speaker on this topic.

description:
Tesla, BMW i8, they are very modern & fashion to cars, not only a new car, also a revolution for automotive industry.

But, there is a big gap to such electronic cars, "power provider".

Let's image, if those electronic cars can't get power as easy as fuel now for traditional cars, the revolution couldn't go further.

It will must be happened in the near future. We can be sure that millions of "power provider" lied on the roads, which "power provider" will provide easy, fast service to cars. There are many business opportunities to us. How to manage such a lot of "power provider"? What kind of value-added service we can find out?

We could meet-up and find the appropriate services which can host in cloud service.

e.g. Create a manage system for "power provider", and can listen every "power provider" node status, to schedule a maintenance plan.

It's brand new business for every company, and it's a "blue sea".

Let's discover the chance and take advantage.
name: Cloud Service to smart electronic cars industry

Information has become one of the world’s most valuable natural resources. We’re swimming in data, but it can be challenging to capitalize on it. description:
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/training-cloud-foundry-v3-transition-to-diego-tickets-16431398756

If you are planning to attend CF Summit in Santa Clara, May 11-12, consider joining these hands-on trainings right after the summit.

Please choose your level and RSVP for each training separately.

BEGINNER LEVEL

5/13, "Deploying an app to Cloud Foundry"

Dave Nielsen, a cloud computing evangelist and consultant, will start with an overview of the available CF services and programming languages. After that, he will proceed with a step-by-step tutorial on how to build a data-driven Web app for Cloud Foundry and deploy it to Pivotal Web Services. → RSVP here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/training-deploying-a-cloud-foundry-app-to-cloud-foundry-tickets-16525515261

5/13, "Deploying Cloud Foundry"

Dave Nielsen, a cloud computing evangelist and consultant, will demonstrate how to install BOSH CLI and deploy BOSH Lite. You will get an overview of CF components, see how they interact with each other, learn to create the CF manifest, and deploy a CF release. By the end of the day, you will be able to deploy an app to Cloud Foundry using the CF CLI. → RSVP here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/training-deploying-cloud-foundry-beginner-tickets-16525761999

ADVANCED LEVEL

5/13, "Deploying Cloud Foundry"

Alan Moran, Cloud Foundry Architect at Altoros, will show how to set up and deploy BOSH and install BOSH CLI. You will take a closer look at the CF architecture and components, and learn how they interact (app lifecycle, logging, user authentication, internal communications, etc.). Using the CF CLI, you will finally deploy an app to the Cloud Foundry PaaS. → RSVP here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/training-deploying-cloud-foundry-advanced-tickets-14780018433

5/14, "Cloud Foundry v3: Transition to Diego"

Alan Moran, Cloud Foundry Architect at Altoros, will introduce you to Diego (the new CF runtime), Lattice (a Cloud Foundry-based project for running containerized workloads on a cluster), and key algorithms of container management. He will demonstrate how to run Diego alongside with DEA, how to run Blue-Green deployments on both Diego and DEA, and how to deploy a Lattice cluster on AWS. → RSVP here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/training-deploying-cloud-foundry-advanced-tickets-14780018433 ;

Register now, as the space is limited!
name: Cloud Foundry Trainings in Santa Clara: for Beginners and Pros
group_name: The Boston Area Cloud Foundry Meetup

description:
Join us for your hands on labs with the Internet of Things (IOT) in the cloud with instructor David Krier and Mark Frederick. This meetup will have you creating an IOT application that you will build in the cloud with an introduction to other cloud capabilities you can add. Below are the details to sign up in advance for the free 30 day trial to use for the hands on labs or you can signup at immediately before the labs begin.

All our meetups are free.

Food will be provided.

Please remember to bring your laptop.

Here is the link to register for the free 30 day Bluemix cloud: https://ibm.biz/bluemixchicago

Dave Krier is a Cloud Solutions Architect within IBM's software group, with several years of experience as a software developer and systems architect. He has a strong history in the financial and insurance industry working with some of the nations top corporations. He has authored several Developer Works articles on various technical topics. He is one of many evangelists on IBM's new Digital Innovation Platform (Bluemix) and enjoys designing and implementing IoT devices. He currently lives in Des Moines Iowa and supports several clients in the Midwest.

Mark Frederick is a Cloud Software Architect with a focus on Bluemix within IBM's software group. Having spent nearly half his career in consulting as a software architect, he has now settled down in Des Moines, IA and works with IBM customers in the mid-west to better understand how IBM solutions can help them be successful. When he's not spending time with his family, he enjoys combining his interest in IoT and electronics with Cloud Computing and emerging technologies.

If you have questions, please post them here. If for any reason you need assistance on the day of the event, please text/call me, Valinda Kennedy, on my cell[masked]
name: Internet of Things (IOT) Walk Thru and Lab -- Create Your First IOT App!

IBM Bluemixはアプリケーションの構築、管理、実行するためのクラウド・プラットフォームです。

IBM Bluemix is a Platform-as-a-Service (Paas) that supports several programming languages and services as well as integrated DevOps to build, run, deploy and manage applications on the cloud.

This session will go through the basic overview of IBM Bluemix, and demo how to start developing Web, Mobile, IoT, or Data/Analytics apps quickly.

description:
Join us in New York City on May 14th for our NYC IBM Bluemix Meetup!

Today organizations and individuals are navigating a maze of ever-increasing data that can be difficult to roam through, let alone control and dissect. Join us in hearing how businesses can get increased value from data insights gained through big data analytics supported by a cloud infrastructure, presented by Bruce Weed.

Agenda:5:30pm: Networking/Food & Beverages

6:00pm: Welcome and Announcements

6:15pm: Big Data on Bluemix, Bruce Weed

- What is Bluemix? - Bluemix Big Data & Watson Services- Why Leverage Big Data- What is Watson?- Use Cases- Benefits of Big Data

7:30pm: Wrap-up

7:45pm: Networking

If you plan to participate in the hands-on session, please bring your laptop. Get a head start by registering at https://ibm.biz/NYC_Meetup and bring your log-on info to the Meetup.

About our Speaker:Bruce Weed is the city leader (New York and Chicago) for IBM’s Cloud business development with Startups and developers. His focus and expertise are around Big Data and Watson.

Mr. Weed has extensive experience in business development, sales and marketing. Additional skills and experience lie in product and brand management, operational strategy, IT strategy, channels and software development.

He runs the LinkedIn groups on both Watson and IBM Big Data and Analytics that look at both use cases and technology trends. He is also a Big Data & Watson evangelist who keynotes many major conferences around the world including, but not limited to:

v Big Data Summit NYC – Keynote Speaker

v OnFinance Conference – Startup Judge

v Connected Car Expo Los Angeles – Speaker and Panelist

v MassTLC Big Data Summit - Panelist with Tom Davenport

v Battle of the Quants – Keynote Speaker

v LegalTech - Big Data Panelist

v NYC Financial Asset Management Council Panelist on Big Data

v New Jersey Technology Council Panelist on Big Data

v Big Data Government Conference, Washington D.C. – Keynote Speaker

v TED talk at Dev@Insight Event

description:
- Français:

Après la vue d'ensemble sur Hadoop précédente, nous planifions une session dédiée à Apache Spark. Spark, qui est une plate-forme de traitement distribué de données, brille par sa performance, sa facilité d'utilisation, ainsi qu'un ensemble d'outils de plus haut niveau pour faciliter son usage. Grâce à son intégration sur Hadoop, Apache Spark s'impose de facto comme une alternative attractive par rapport à Map Reduce.

Cette présentation sera dédiée à Spark, avec une revue de son architecture, ses composants, son fonctionnement ainsi que son intégration sur Hadoop. Une démonstration sera faite en fin de session à partir d`un Lab. Nous essayerons dans la mesure du possible de partager les instructions du Lab à l`avance pour ceux qui souhaitent le faire durant la session.

Cette session est de niveau introductive sur Spark. Elle sera bénéfique à l`ensemble des participants qui ont assisté à la première session de ce Meetup sur Hadoop, et aussi ceux familiers avec Hadoop, ou en général familiers avec la problématique de traitement de données massives à des fins analytiques (R, bases de données MPP).

Le matériel sera en Anglais. La présentation sera faite en Français. L`interaction avec le présentateur et les discussions peuvent être faites en Anglais ou Français selon votre préférence.

- English:

After the initial Hadoop overview, we are planning a session on Apache Spark. Spark, as an engine for large scale data processing, is shining by its speed, its ease of use, and a set of higher level tools to facilitate its use. With its integration on Hadoop, Apache Spark is seen as the de facto alternative to Map Reduce.

This presentation will focus on Spark, with a review of its architecture, its components, its operation, as well as its integration on Hadoop. A demo will be done at the end of the session based on a Lab. We will try our best to share the instructions for the Lab in advance for those who are willing to do it during the session.

This session is of an introductory level on Spark. It will be beneficial to the audience who attended the first session on Hadoop, as well as those familiar with Hadoop, or generally familiar with the problematic of big data processing for analytics purpose (R, MPP databases).

The material will be in English. The presentation will be in French. Interaction with the speaker, and discussions can be held in either English or French according to your preference.
name: Apache Spark

description:
What Will You Build with Watson on Bluemix?

Imagine if you could understand the personality characteristics of your customers at a deeper level. Imagine if you could find new, related pathways in your data to make discoveries in a fraction of the time you could before. This is the power of what can be achieved with Cognitive Computing. Quick test, ask your phone “find anything but pizza restaurants”. Did you get back a list of pizza restaurants? Think about how we’ve been trained to keyword search. We have all been Google-fied & we may not even know it. Humans adapt their language, one that predates machines, to the limitations of a system.

IBM Watson, the cognitive technology that enhances, scales, & accelerates human expertise. Watson's cognitive capabilities on Bluemix will enhance apps & help developers realize ideas not possible with today's systems. Watson is not a machine that lets us talk to it. It’s bigger, and that’s why this is a historic moment for developers, businesses & entrepreneurs. IBM is creating tools that can understand language, determine a personality portrait, expand concepts & more. In this session we will discuss & demo Watson Services on Bluemix & how developers can now embed these into their apps for unprecedented cognitive power.

Speaker Bio

Swami Chandrasekaran (@swamichandra) is as an Executive Architect and technical leader in the IBM Watson CTO Office. In this role, he sets & drives the technical agenda for cognitive computing, and works with customers on building IBM Watson-based cognitive, analytics & big data solutions. His team is also responsible for driving the technical strategy around domain adaptation of Watson for various solutions in key industries, such as healthcare, telecom, public sector and financial services.,

Prior to his current role, Swami was the Chief Architect for IBM Software - Business Solutions. Under his leadership, his team worked with several customers in the areas of OSS/BSS transformation, Cloud Service Broker, Cloud Storefronts, Digital Media Supply Chain, Mobile Payments, Smart Metering, Real-time & Contextual Campaigns. He has previous experience at Webify, KPMG, BearingPoint and Ericsson Research. He has holds a Masters in Electrical Engineering from UT Arlington and authored several books & publications in the areas of natural language processing, data science, BPM, SOA and enterprise integration.

Sign up for Bluemix no-charge trial, here - https://ibm.biz/Meetup_Dallas
name: Pub & Dinner topic: What will you build with Watson on IBM Bluemix?

description:
6:30 - Networking & Pizza/Salads

7:00 - Presentation

In February 2015, industry leaders in the big data space, including GE, Hortonworks, IBM, Infosys, Pivotal, SAS, and others, announced their intent to create an industry association, identified as the Open Data Platform (“ODP”). The objective of this association was to promote open source-based big data technologies, optimize the testing across the ecosystem vendors, and accelerate the ability of enterprises to build or implement data-driven applications. In this presentation, Rakesh, as an expert in IBM BigInsights (IBM's Hadoop Distribution), will provide a brief overview of the major open source Hadoop tecnologies, how ODP integrates them, and how you can benefit in participatiing with, and adoption of, ODP. You will also learn how IBM incorporates ODP, and further expands on this platform with the addition of enterprise-rich features with BigInsigts 4.0.
name: The Move to Open Source Hadoop

description:
Special Guest Confirmed: James Watters

Please join us for this special event in which Java experts, Jeff Holmes and Scott Deeg, review some of the newest innovations in Cloud Foundry.

Topics

• Cloud Foundry Summit Highlights http://www.cfsummit.com/

• Demonstration of building a SPA (single page application) application using a Polymer front-end (Google's WebComponents framework) and a Java/Spring backend. Emphasis is on showing the important pieces working together which includes the JavaScript frontend, ReSTful services, UI server, service proxy (Zuul), and basic security.

• Lattice http://lattice.cf/

Overview and demo of the new Lattice project by deploying a Spring Boot application as a Docker image. Lattice is a great way to explore the benefits of Cloud Foundry and Diego, the new container execution and distributed scheduling component of Cloud Foundry that supports deploying Docker images and .NET applications.

Speaker Bio's

Jeff Holmes - Jeff Holmes has over 20 years of experience in the software industry and is particularly interested in the intersection of PaaS and IaaS. His background includes roles as a software engineer, application and enterprise architect. He's worked on agile development projects as well as a considerable number of Java/Spring and Enterprise Java projects, and even deployed a hybrid .NET applications to Azure. As a field engineer for Pivotal, he focuses on Pivotal Cloud Foundry and helps customers understand its value and 'kick the tires'.

Scott Deeg - Describing himself just a Plain Old Java Geek (POJG), Scott Deeg began his journey with Java in 1996 as a member of the Visual Café team at Symantec. From there he worked primarily as a consultant and solution architect in the world of enterprise Java applications. Now a part of Pivotal, he continues to work with large enterprises on their application platform and data needs. A big fan of open source software and technology, he tries to occasionally get out of the corporate world to talk about interesting things happening in the Java/OSS community, and has delivered technical talks at Pivotal OSS meetups, Silicon Valley Code Camp, SVForum, and SpringOne.
name: CF Summit Recap + CF-Spring Integration + Running Containerized Workloads

description:
Apache Spark has taken the big data community by storm, but what does this mean to you? Come hack with us for a unique opportunity to experiment with capabilities of Spark. This 3-day hackathon will give you the chance to learn, test and extract value using Spark. Our experts will be on hand to offer guidance and tips as you hack your way to the finish. Oh, and did we mention we have $10,000 in cash prizes?!

It is encouraged that all participants take the Spark Fundamentals course on Big Data University prior to the hackathon. The Docker image used in the course is the same for our hackathon.

Rules and Judging Criteria

For the app to be eligible, hackers must adhere to the following:

· Successfully use spark· Original idea (not submitted to a previous hackathon)· Submit a video demo

Apps will be judged based on:

· Innovation: Have you created something completely new/different?· Creativity: How cool is this app?· Functionality: How functional was the tech in the demo?

Join us for an intro to our How Smart is your App Hack on May 7th

description:
Join us on May 28th for a chance to interact with IBM and Tachyon users and the developers to hear how Tachyon can help improve big data analytics (ad-hoc query) efficiency within Baidu.

Currently within Baidu, we have a production Tachyon cluster with 100 nodes and over 2 PB of storage space, this cluster mainly serves as the cache layer for our Big Data Analytics engine. In this talk, first we introduce the Big Data Analytic infrastructure within Baidu. Then, we explain why we started using Tachyon a few months ago, as well as the problems encountered when we started using Tachyon. Next, we delve into the details of how Tachyon helps accelerate our Big Data Analytics pipeline at its current state. At the end, we discuss what new features we want to see and the plan to scale further. Hear from Baidu who will share lessons learned from Tachyon deployments in production as well as Tachyon Nexus who will share exciting news related to Tachyon.

Tachyon recent development: Tachyon 0.6.4 was recently released, with significant improvements to the overall system. This talk will touch on the features recently developed on Tachyon, including the alpha release of Tiered Storage in 0.64. Haoyuan Li is founder and CEO of Tachyon Nexus. He is also a Computer Science Ph.D. candidate in AMPLab at UC Berkeley, where he co-created Tachyon, an open memory-centric distributed system. He is a founding committer of Apache Spark.

Agenda:

06:00-06:30 - Food and Networking06:30-07:30 - Presentations07:30-07:45 - Q&A07:45-08:00 - Thank you for attending

See you there!
name: Fast Big Data Analytics with Spark on Tachyon in Baidu

description:
Topic:

IT Operations Analytics (ITOA) is an approach or method applied to application software designed to retrieve, analyze and report data for IT operations. ITOA has been described as applying big data analytics to the IT realm [Wikipedia]. We will discuss Big Data analytic approaches embedded in log analysis and predictive insights as applied to operational management data such as events, configuration data and application and system logs.

Presenter:

Michael Kaczmarski, CTO, IT Service Management, IBM Systems Middleware, 9000 S. Rita Road, Tucson, AZ 85744 ([masked]).

Mr. Kaczmarski is an IBM Fellow and Chief Technology Officer IT Service Management Products. He is currently driving efforts to integrate the cloud hosting services environment and user experience for service management capabilities delivered through software as a service (SaaS) in support of Hybrid cloud workloads. He leads cross product architecture efforts through customer relationships and development team strategy. Deeply involved in bringing Tivoli Storage Manager to market from its birth in IBM research, Michael worked on storage software products for over 14 years. His 32 year history with IBM has also included database design and development, scientific programming and IT management and support. He has Masters degree in Computer Science from National Technological University and a Bachelor’s Degree in Management Information Systems from the University of Arizona.
name: IT Operations Analytics (ITOA) & Big Data Analytic Approaches

description:
PLEASE NOTE THAT THIS HANDS-ON WORKSHOP HAS BEEN RESCHEDULED TO JUNE 3, 2015. LOCATION AND CONTENT, AND REGISTRATION LINK REMAINS THE SAME.

Join the Evolving Solutions technical team and experts from IBM for a hands-on workshop on June 3, 2015 at the Minneapolis Marriott Southwest. In this session we will install and configure a Hadoop cluster in a cloud environment provided by Evolving Solutions. We will discuss common enterprise use cases and the preparation and planning needed to ensure a cluster meets the needs of your organization. Take this opportunity to better understand the infrastructure challenges and considerations for Hadoop in your business, without having to build your own lab. This hands-on workshop is designed for System Admins, Infrastructure Architects and Big Data Enthusiasts.

This workshop is a customer event. In order to confirm your registration for this workshop, please go to this link: http://ibm.co/1b84KO7

What is Hadoop? Apache™ Hadoop® is an open source software project that enables distributed processing of large data sets across clusters of commodity servers. It is designed to scale up from a single server to thousands of machines, with very high degree of fault tolerance. Rather than relying on high-end hardware, the resiliency of these clusters comes from the software's ability to detect and handle failures at the application layer.

Please bring your own laptop for this workshop. An IBM Softlayer cloud environment will be provided to get you started. Questions about the cloud environment can be directed to Amber Murphy at [masked].

The workshop will begin at 12:00 pm with registration and lunch and will conclude at 5:00 pm. Join Evolving Solutions following the meeting for networking with appetizers and beverages in the Marriott lobby lounge.

Evolving Solutions is a leading IT infrastructure, software and cloud services provider in the Minneapolis/St. Paul metro area and has spent 20 years building relationships with many medium and large enterprises in North America. Evolving Solutions has become a strategic partner that clients are able to depend upon for assistance in key solutions throughout the technology lifecycle. From assessing and planning to implementation and maintenance, they have professional skills, consultants and engineers to be trusted technology advisors. www.evolvingsol.com

description:
PLEASE NOTE THAT THIS MEETUP WILL BE HELD IN THE SAN JOSE CONVENTION CENTER IN ROOM LL21A.

A growing number of organizations today recognize Apache Hadoop as a powerful technology for collecting and economically storing a very large set of highly variable data, and yet they struggle to realize its full potential in every part of their business. For example, a business analyst needs to quickly find relevant information, the data scientist needs to make sense of the data with statistical modeling, and the whole environment needs to be easy for IT to manage and deploy for everyone to use. As the size and complexity of Hadoop applications continues to grow, data science has become a critical function for unlocking meaningful insights and identifying actions that could optimize outcomes across the entire business.

In February 2015, several diverse companies launched an initiative aimed to define a core platform that will enable faster development and wider enterprise adoption of big data projects. The Open Data Platform (ODP), according to the founding members, is an industry association assembled to promote open-source data initiatives, particularly those revolving around the Hadoop analytics framework.

Join us on June 8th at 6:30 pm (immediately after the Hadoop Summit Reception at the Marriott Hotel - Salons 1-4 - 5:00 pm to 6:00 pm) at the San Jose Convention Center - Room LL21A to hear several Open Data Platform (ODP) founding members talk about the innovation with the platform and the exciting opportunities to engage.

Hadoop Summit Reception - Marriott Hotel (attached to Convention Center) - Salons 1-4. Food and drink provided.

Meetup location - San Jose Convention Center - Room LL21A - 6:30 pm - refreshments/food provided.

See you there.
name: Big Data & the Open Data Platform Initiative

description:
Join us at the EMC Cambridge Innovation Center on Thursday, June 11th from 6:00 to 8:00 pm. We have a great speaker: Chip Childers, Technology Chief of Staff, Cloud Foundry Foundation.

Title: The Makings of a Modern Application Architecture

It wasn’t too long ago that artisans, bathed in the glow of molten metal, forged parts that would go on to make up bigger, more powerful machines. Today, we call those artisans developers. Instead of metal, they use bits and bytes in the cloud to forge a modern application architecture that supports public, private and hybrid application deployment. One that enables users and developers to move their applications wherever they need to go. And it’s built on a growing, vibrant ecosystem.

Nowhere is this epic shift in how things are made more visible than the meteoric adoption of Cloud Foundry. In this talk, Cloud Foundry technology chief of staff Chip Childers will give attendees an inside look at the economic forces that have made Cloud Foundry the fastest growing open source project in history.

He will also provide a look at the technologies driving this new level of efficiency for application developers (tech like containers, Docker, Kubernetes, OpenStack, Cloud Foundry and social coding tools like GitHub). And he’ll explain why many prominent members of the Fortune 500 are building their futures on this modern application architecture.

Speaker: Chip Childers, Technology Chief of Staff, Cloud Foundry Foundation
name: The Makings of a Modern Application Architecture
group_name: The Boston Area Cloud Foundry Meetup

description:
Use BIG DATA to create INTELLIGENCE of THINGS - Cloud Developer Bootcamp - Co-hosted by TechLAB, Big Object & IBM

Calling all mobile developers, entrepreneurs and cloud enthusiasts!

Creating intelligence and decisions from a mountain of data is challenging! Join us for technical hands-on workshops to learn to derive deep business insight from innovation solutions to learn to derive deep business insight from innovation solutions built on Internet of Things (IoT) and mobile.

And as a bonus, network with fellow developers!

Bring your laptop and innovative ideas. We will provide resources, fun and refreshments!

Agenda:

1pm - Registration and welcome

1:30pm - Panel discussion: Big Data Analytics & Cloud

2:30pm - IoT Demo & Hands-On Lab

4pm - Mobile Demo & Hands-On Lab

5:30pm - Networking Reception

** Would love to have you come the whole time, but you can register for portions if needed to fit your schedule.

Reserve your seat: ibm.biz/SVBootcamp
name: FREE! Use BIG DATA to create INTELLIGENCE of THINGS - Cloud Developer Bootcamp

description:
Apache Spark has taken the big data community by storm, but what does this mean to you? Come hack with us for a unique opportunity to experiment with capabilities of Spark and a chance to win up to $7,500. This 3-day hackathon will give you the chance to learn, test and extract value using Spark. Our experts will be on hand to offer guidance and tips as you hack your way to the finish.

You can find more info here: http://hackspark.github.io

Did we mention we will have $10,000 in cash prizes???

Prizes:

• 1st Place: $7,500

• 2nd Place: $2,500

Rules

• Max of 3 members per team.

• Original idea (not submitted to a previous hackathon).

• Successfully extract value using Spark.

• Use Data Scientist Workbench as the development and demonstration platform.

• Submit solution's code to the hackathon's GitHub organization. Your team must include all notebooks created in Data Scientist Workbench.

• Present solution to a panel of judges (10 minutes in total for presentation and demo).

Judging Criteria

• Innovation: How innovative is the solution?

• Relevance: Does it solve a real problem?

• Functionality: How functional is your code?

Schedule

Friday, June 12th

4:00 PM Registration and Networking5:00 PM Welcome and Introductions5:30 PM Environment Demo and Hackathon Guidelines6:00 PM Dinner, Team breakouts & idea creation12:00 AM Wrap up for the day

Saturday, June 13th

9:00 AM Breakfast and Announcements9:45 AM Get hacking!12:00 PM Lunch6:00 PM Dinner12:00 AM Wrap-up for the day

Sunday, June 14th

9:00 AM Breakfast and Hack to the finish line10:30 AM Hackathon stops! Presentation Prep11:00 AM Presentations and lunch• 10 minute presentations to a panel of judges 12:45 PM Closing announcements1:00 PM Doors close

Winners will be announced Tuesday, June 16th!

Note there is a seat limit for this hackathon - please make sure you get on Slack on confirm your attendance.
name: How Smart can you Hack with Spark?

description:
Dear Big Data Enthusiast,

Greetings,

Join Mumbai Big Data Meetup on 13th June to learn the latest on Big Data and Analytics for cutting edge insight, business intelligence and ROI.

The meetup discussions will have specific focus on data analytics, infrastructure, process, technology and culture all need to be in place and working cohesively to maximize the return of big data and analytics.

We are going to have an action packed panel discussion "Demystifying Data Scientist"

Additionally, we will discuss the latest on Big Data technology covering Hadoop, Streaming Analytics, Bluemix and explore why such alternate technologies have become an area of keen interest for many organizations to finding alternates to improvising operational efficiencies by maximizing savings.

This is a FREE event and only requirement is to sign-up at above mentioned link to RSVP and stay connected with Mumbai Big Data community.

Additionally, you may invite your customers as well as post the enclosed event brochure at your customer locations too.

Venue: Don Bosco Institute of Technology, Opposite Kohinoor Mall, Kurla(W), Mumbai.

Time: 13th June, 2015 from 9.30 AM through 2.00 PM

9:30 am to 10:00 am Registration

10:00 am to 10:45 am Keynote - Banking Hadoop Use Cases-Shri. Sonny George-General Manager-State Bank of India

10:45 am to 11:45 am "Demystifying Data Scientist" Panel by-Shri. S.V. Sunder Krishnan-Chief Risk Officer-Reliance Life Insurance Company Limited, Shri. Bhupesh Daheria, Founder of Aegis Graham Bell Awards

12:00 pm to 1:00 pm Real Time Big Data Applications-Shri. Tushar Kale

1:00 pm to 2:00 pm - EDW Hadoop Implementation-Shri. Dulal Mali-Deputy General Manager-Bombay Stock Exchange

Thank you for your support and I look forward meeting up with you.

Tushar Kale

Big Data Evangelist

name: Mumbai Big Data Meetup 2Q2015

description:
Room 905/907 on the 9th Floor

Agenda

5pm - 6:30pm - Hands on workshop and presentation

Abstract

Enterprise customers have significant investments in the Windows ecosystem. They have hundreds (or thousands!) of apps written in ASP.NET and WCF but have struggled to bring them to market quickly. Let’s talk about how the addition of full end-to-end Windows .NET support in Cloud Foundry enables developers to deploy and manage their Windows .NET applications in their Cloud Foundry cluster. How .NET developers can utilize the Visual Studio Cloud Foundry integration and how MSBuild support enables build agents to interact with Cloud Foundry.

We need folks to bring a Windows laptop with Visual Studio 2013 installed please. It takes too long to install during the workshop. You can install the community edition that is free:

https://www.visualstudio.com/en-us/downloads/download-visual-studio-vs.aspx

Speaker

Gert Drapers is the Distinguished Engineer and Engineering Director of the HP Helion Cloud Foundry project, where he applies his 25+ years of operating system, compiler, database and distributed systems experience to enhance the enterprise application landscape by leveraging and contributing to the Cloud Foundry, Kubernetes and Docker ecosystems.
name: Developing and Delivering Windows Applications with Cloud Foundry - Workshop
group_name: New York City Cloud Foundry Meetup

description:
Have you ever wished you could create a web, mobile, or big data app in a few hours? In days past it might take weeks or months to create an app. With IBM's new Bluemix cloud based Platform-as-a-Service, software developers can now build apps in hours or days rather than in weeks or months.

In cooperation with Cube and Bio-AM, IBM invites you to participate in a Bluemix "Code Jam" from 5 - 8 pm on June 15. The event will be held at the Cube at 328 S. Broadway in Rochester. Come learn about Bluemix, IBM's new cloud development platform. As part of this code jam you will be able to learn the fundamentals of building and deploying your application in the Cloud.

In the Jam we will have a number of ideas, but if you have been thinking of an app you would like to create and are willing to share it with the event community then please send us your idea. Maybe you have an idea of a new way to use social data, or a cognitive computing idea, or something related to Internet of Things. Whatever it might be, let us know and we may use them for the event. Please submit your idea by sending a Meetup message or email directly to Matt Paschal ([masked]).

Leveraging IBM Bluemix, you can take your idea or problem, design it, and create it all in the cloud. IBM experts will be on hand to help coach you in how to use Bluemix to create your applications.

If you would like to try out IBM Bluemix before the Jam, you can sign up here: ibm.biz/Rochester_Meetup.

Remember to bring your laptop, because we will be doing live coding. We look forward to seeing you on June 15 at the Cube!
name: Create an app in hours at IBM's Bluemix Code Jam

description:
We will be live-streaming in Vancouver.. (Burnaby)..

IBM is hosting a Spark Community event in San Francisco, California: IBM | Spark - The Start of Something Big in Data and Design. There will be a Town Hall discussion featuring some of the most trail-blazing data scientists in today's Spark Community, including:

- Edd Dumbill, VP Strategy, Silicon Valley Data Science- Mike Tamir, Chief Science Officer & VP of Data Science & Education at Galvanize- Fernando Perez, Staff Scientist at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory & Founding Investigator of the Berkeley Institute for Data Science- Haoyuan Li, CEO and Founder of Tachyon Nexus- Shankar Venkataraman, Distinguished Engineer & CTO, IBM Analytics Platform at IBM- Paco Nathan, Director, Community Evangelism, Databricks

Spark Community members will also deliver 5-minute lightning talks to describe exciting projects they're working on.

We will provide a livestream presentation of what these Spark leaders have to say.

Agenda:

6:00 pm - 7:00 pm - Refreshments & Intro to Spark7:00 pm - 8:15 pm - LiveStream From San Francisco8:15 pm - Q&A

Don't miss the opportunity to see this major announcement "live". (location is tentative and subject to change)

---------------------------

Apache Spark is an open source processing engine built around speed, ease of use, and analytics. If you have large amounts of data that requires low latency processing that a typical Map Reduce program cannot provide, Spark is the alternative. Spark performs at speeds up to 100 times faster than Map Reduce for iterative algorithms or interactive data mining. Spark provides in-memory cluster computing for lightning fast speed and supports Java, Scala, and Python APIs for ease of development.

Spark allows data scientists to build models quickly and supports iterative jobs on distributed datasets. This means more people can apply deep intelligence into applications to make everything smarter, including the Internet of Things (IoT), machine learning, web, mobile, social, business process and more.

description:

Apache Spark is an open source processing engine built around speed, ease of use, and analytics. If you have large amounts of data that requires low latency processing that a typical Map Reduce program cannot provide, Spark is the alternative.

Spark performs at speeds up to 100 times faster than Map Reduce for iterative algorithms or interactive data mining. Spark provides in-memory cluster computing for lightning fast speed and supports Java, Scala, and Python APIs for ease of development. Spark allows data scientists to build models quickly and supports iterative jobs on distributed datasets. This means more people can apply deep intelligence into applications to make everything smarter, including the Internet of Things (IoT), machine learning, web, mobile, social, business process and more.

Do you believe in the value of Spark, in the speed, efficiency and flexibility of this in-memory compute engine? IBM does. Emphatically.

That's why we're committed to do everything we can to accelerate the adoption of Spark for enterprise analytics, where Spark promises seemingly unlimited value. On June 15, 2015, IBM will host a Spark Community event in San Francisco, California: IBM | Spark - The Start of Something Big in Data and Design. There will be a live demo showcase, refreshments, and a Town Hall discussion featuring some of the most trail-blazing data scientists in today's Spark Community, including:

- Edd Dumbill, VP Strategy, Silicon Valley Data Science

- Mike Tamir, Chief Science Officer & VP of Data Science & Education at Galvanize

- Fernando Perez, Staff Scientist at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory & Founding Investigator of the Berkeley Institute for Data Science

- Haoyuan Li, CEO and Founder of Tachyon Nexus

- Shankar Venkataraman, Distinguished Engineer & CTO, IBM Analytics Platform at IBM

- Paco Nathan, Director, Community Evangelism, Databricks

Spark Community members will also deliver 5-minute lightning talks to describe exciting projects they're working on.

We will provide a livestream presentation of what these Spark leaders have to say.

Apache Spark is an open source processing engine built around speed, ease of use, and analytics. If you have large amounts of data that requires low latency processing that a typical Map Reduce program cannot provide, Spark is the alternative.

Spark performs at speeds up to 100 times faster than Map Reduce for iterative algorithms or interactive data mining. Spark provides in-memory cluster computing for lightning fast speed and supports Java, Scala, and Python APIs for ease of development. Spark allows data scientists to build models quickly and supports iterative jobs on distributed datasets. This means more people can apply deep intelligence into applications to make everything smarter, including the Internet of Things (IoT), machine learning, web, mobile, social, business process and more.

Do you believe in the value of Spark, in the speed, efficiency and flexibility of this in-memory compute engine? IBM does. Emphatically.That's why we're committed to do everything we can to accelerate the adoption of Spark for enterprise analytics, where Spark promises seemingly unlimited value.

On June 15, 2015, IBM will host a Spark Community event in San Francisco, California: IBM | Spark - The Start of Something Big in Data and Design. There will be a live demo showcase, refreshments, and a Town Hall discussion featuring some of the most trail-blazing data scientists in today's Spark Community, including:

• Edd Dumbill, VP Strategy, Silicon Valley Data Science• Mike Tamir, Chief Science Officer & VP of Data Science & Education at Galvanize• Fernando Perez, Staff Scientist at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory & Founding Investigator of the Berkeley Institute for Data Science• Haoyuan Li, CEO and Founder of Tachyon Nexus• Shankar Venkataraman, Distinguished Engineer & CTO, IBM Analytics Platform at IBM• Paco Nathan, Director, Community Evangelism, Databricks

Spark Community members will also deliver 5-minute lightning talks to describe exciting projects they're working on.

We will provide a livestream presentation of what these Spark leaders have to say.

Live Streaming Link:

To get additional details about Spark you can sign up now for a reminder at:

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

Scroll down to "Can't attend in Person"? Sign up for a reminder and add it to your calendar.

Additional information on Spark:

Link to Spark Fundamentals Course in Big Data University

http://bigdatauniversity.com/bdu-wp/bdu-course/spark-fundamentals/

Link to Spark Technology Information

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

THIS IS A WEB CONFERENCE ONLY. TIME OF WEB CONFERENCE LOCALLY IS BASED ON LIVE-STREAM START - PACIFIC DAYLIGHT TIME. DETAILS TO CONNECT TO LIVE-STREAM ARE INDICATED BELOW.

Apache Spark is an open source processing engine built around speed, ease of use, and analytics. If you have large amounts of data that requires low latency processing that a typical Map Reduce program cannot provide, Spark is the alternative.

Spark performs at speeds up to 100 times faster than Map Reduce for iterative algorithms or interactive data mining. Spark provides in-memory cluster computing for lightning fast speed and supports Java, Scala, and Python APIs for ease of development. Spark allows data scientists to build models quickly and supports iterative jobs on distributed datasets. This means more people can apply deep intelligence into applications to make everything smarter, including the Internet of Things (IoT), machine learning, web, mobile, social, business process and more.

Do you believe in the value of Spark, in the speed, efficiency and flexibility of this in-memory compute engine? IBM does. Emphatically.That's why we're committed to do everything we can to accelerate the adoption of Spark for enterprise analytics, where Spark promises seemingly unlimited value.

On June 15, 2015, IBM will host a Spark Community event in San Francisco, California: IBM | Spark - The Start of Something Big in Data and Design. There will be a live demo showcase, refreshments, and a Town Hall discussion featuring some of the most trail-blazing data scientists in today's Spark Community, including: Edd Dumbill, VP Strategy, Silicon Valley Data Science• Mike Tamir, Chief Science Officer & VP of Data Science & Education at Galvanize• Fernando Perez, Staff Scientist at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory & Founding Investigator of the Berkeley Institute for Data Science• Haoyuan Li, CEO and Founder of Tachyon Nexus• Shankar Venkataraman, Distinguished Engineer & CTO, IBM Analytics Platform at IBM• Paco Nathan, Director, Community Evangelism, Databricks

Spark Community members will also deliver 5-minute lightning talks to describe exciting projects they're working on.

We will provide a livestream presentation of what these Spark leaders have to say.

Live Streaming Link:

To get additional details about Spark you can sign up now for a reminder at:

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

Scroll down to "Can't attend in Person"? Sign up for a reminder and add it to your calendar.

Additional information on Spark:

Link to Spark Fundamentals Course in Big Data University

http://bigdatauniversity.com/bdu-wp/bdu-course/spark-fundamentals/

Link to Spark Technology Information

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

Apache Spark is an open source processing engine built around speed, ease of use, and analytics. If you have large amounts of data that requires low latency processing that a typical Map Reduce program cannot provide, Spark is the alternative.

Spark performs at speeds up to 100 times faster than Map Reduce for iterative algorithms or interactive data mining. Spark provides in-memory cluster computing for lightning fast speed and supports Java, Scala, and Python APIs for ease of development. Spark allows data scientists to build models quickly and supports iterative jobs on distributed datasets. This means more people can apply deep intelligence into applications to make everything smarter, including the Internet of Things (IoT), machine learning, web, mobile, social, business process and more.

Do you believe in the value of Spark, in the speed, efficiency and flexibility of this in-memory compute engine? IBM does. Emphatically.That's why we're committed to do everything we can to accelerate the adoption of Spark for enterprise analytics, where Spark promises seemingly unlimited value.

On June 15, 2015, IBM will host a Spark Community event in San Francisco, California: IBM | Spark - The Start of Something Big in Data and Design. There will be a live demo showcase, refreshments, and a Town Hall discussion featuring some of the most trail-blazing data scientists in today's Spark Community, including: Edd Dumbill, VP Strategy, Silicon Valley Data Science• Mike Tamir, Chief Science Officer & VP of Data Science & Education at Galvanize• Fernando Perez, Staff Scientist at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory & Founding Investigator of the Berkeley Institute for Data Science• Haoyuan Li, CEO and Founder of Tachyon Nexus• Shankar Venkataraman, Distinguished Engineer & CTO, IBM Analytics Platform at IBM• Paco Nathan, Director, Community Evangelism, Databricks

Spark Community members will also deliver 5-minute lightning talks to describe exciting projects they're working on.

We will provide a livestream presentation of what these Spark leaders have to say.

Live Streaming Link:

To get additional details about Spark you can sign up now for a reminder at:

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

Scroll down to "Can't attend in Person"? Sign up for a reminder and add it to your calendar.

Link to Spark Fundamentals Course in Big Data University

http://bigdatauniversity.com/bdu-wp/bdu-course/spark-fundamentals/

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

THIS IS A WEB CONFERENCE ONLY. TIME OF WEB CONFERENCE LOCALLY IS BASED ON LIVE-STREAM START - PACIFIC DAYLIGHT TIME. DETAILS TO CONNECT TO LIVE-STREAM ARE INDICATED BELOW.

Apache Spark is an open source processing engine built around speed, ease of use, and analytics. If you have large amounts of data that requires low latency processing that a typical Map Reduce program cannot provide, Spark is the alternative.

Spark performs at speeds up to 100 times faster than Map Reduce for iterative algorithms or interactive data mining. Spark provides in-memory cluster computing for lightning fast speed and supports Java, Scala, and Python APIs for ease of development. Spark allows data scientists to build models quickly and supports iterative jobs on distributed datasets. This means more people can apply deep intelligence into applications to make everything smarter, including the Internet of Things (IoT), machine learning, web, mobile, social, business process and more.

Do you believe in the value of Spark, in the speed, efficiency and flexibility of this in-memory compute engine? IBM does. Emphatically.That's why we're committed to do everything we can to accelerate the adoption of Spark for enterprise analytics, where Spark promises seemingly unlimited value.

On June 15, 2015, IBM will host a Spark Community event in San Francisco, California: IBM | Spark - The Start of Something Big in Data and Design. There will be a live demo showcase, refreshments, and a Town Hall discussion featuring some of the most trail-blazing data scientists in today's Spark Community, including:

• Edd Dumbill, VP Strategy, Silicon Valley Data Science• Mike Tamir, Chief Science Officer & VP of Data Science & Education at Galvanize• Fernando Perez, Staff Scientist at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory & Founding Investigator of the Berkeley Institute for Data Science• Haoyuan Li, CEO and Founder of Tachyon Nexus• Shankar Venkataraman, Distinguished Engineer & CTO, IBM Analytics Platform at IBM• Paco Nathan, Director, Community Evangelism, Databricks

Spark Community members will also deliver 5-minute lightning talks to describe exciting projects they're working on.

We will provide a livestream presentation of what these Spark leaders have to say.

Live Streaming Link:

To get additional details about Spark you can sign up now for a reminder at:

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

Scroll down to "Can't attend in Person"? Sign up for a reminder and add it to your calendar.

http://bigdatauniversity.com/bdu-wp/bdu-course/spark-fundamentals/

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

- Smart Nation intro by IDA- Overview of IBM Cloud (Bluemix/SL)- IBM IOT Foundation- Build Mobile App with Bluemix- Big Data and Analytics with Bluemix- Wrap up

*Bring your own laptop

Register here for your Bluemix account.
name: Hackathon@SG Bluemix Workshop (IOT, Mobile and Data)

description:
This is a great chance to discuss the cloud basics to get started, as well as, for more advanced users what are some of the Open and Enterprise resources in the Bluemix cloud. Everyone can get started with 30 days for free. For Entrepreneurs and Startups drop-in to get 1K/month for one year at no-charge with the potential for that to be 10K/month for a year, again at no-charge.

Look for Valinda Kennedy, John Clark, Barb Irby, Jerry Haan or Evan Kedzierski --see their faces in the members section of this meetup. For any questions, call Valinda Kennedy on[masked]
name: Office Hours to answer questions about free cloud & global entrepreneur program
group_name: Chicago PaaS, Bluemix and Cloud Computing Meetup

description:
We invite you to join IBM, our business partners, and female entrepreneurs for a special, one day event devoted to Women in Tech. You'll hear from women leaders about the secrets to their success in the male dominated world of technology, leadership, and establishing your own personal brand. We'll then segue to technology and show you how the cloud offers you the ability to innovate and disrupt business models. Even if you've never written an app or are a seasoned developer, we'll have hands on segments that are right for you. Learn the latest on the Internet of Things, mobile solutions in the cloud, and cloud cognitive computing with IBM Watson. The IBM Cloud EcoSystem team is on the ground in the New York City working with developers, entrepreneurs and startups to showcase the power of IBM's Cloud platform, including Bluemix, SoftLayer, Watson, IoT and Mobile.

Embrace the power of cloud to optimize, innovate and disrupt business models!

Audience: This event is open to all women in tech including corporate developers, startups, entrepreneurs, students, professors, and anyone else interested in learning and networking.

http://www.ibm.com/privacy/us/en/
name: Women in Tech; Pursue your Power

description:
Today's business environment is demanding greater flexibility in order to introduce new products to market faster. This requirement demands that new tools be available that promote such products to an ever increasingly interconnected, mobile, and social world.

As a result, the digital fabric supporting the business must be designed for utmost flexibility in order to support modern business processes, and customer and partner interactions.

IBM has led the way in embracing new technologies to provide business solutions that benefit enterprises. Now, IBM is helping to define this new era of cloud computing via the IBM open cloud architecture, which reduces concerns of vendor lock-in and fosters an open API economy.

Through Bluemix and SoftLayer, IBM has introduced the core capabilities necessary to enable the enterprise for the world of systems of interaction and cloud-centric applications. IBM continues to enhance Bluemix and continues this journey of innovation for its clients.

Learn how IBM Bluemix – Digital Innovation Platform, helps you to innovate your business and revolutionize the way you think and bring to life disruptive ideas. Through the presentation of a variety of use cases in the Public Sector, underpinned by fundamental design principles of direct applicability to many other Industries, you will explore how to create sophisticated software applications and develop a key API-driven ecosystem of developers and 3rd-parties to boost revenues and brand engagement.
name: Think, develop and monetize your ideas at the speed of light
group_name: IBM Cloud Vietnam - Together We Change The World

The first one will demonstrate linear regression using Apache Spark. For the second one, Andrey Vykhodtsev from IBM Slovenia will show us IBM's Big Data offerings.

Mark the date in your calendars and see you on June 17!

If you are already using Spark please contact me and we may ask you to say a few words! eMail: [masked]
name: Lighting the Spark!

description:
Right now, IBM is placing its biggest bet on open source innovation since we led the adoption of Linux through hundreds of business solutions. On June 15th, we are announcing our commitment to Apache Spark, an in-memory compute engine that delivers eye-opening speed and flexibility to data scientists and developers working with big data at scale.

In fact, we are bringing the speed, agility and power of Spark into our Analytics Platform to make sure we're meeting the emerging needs of data-driven enterprises.

After our initial launch on June 15th in San Francisco, we will be hosting a regional Spark Signature Moment Event in Seattle on June 17th, 2015.

Join Us for lunch to Learn More About Our Commitment to Open Source and How to Spark Innovation

Agenda

* Reception and introduction by IBM regional executive* Highlights from IBM Signature Moment Round Table in San Francisco* Presentation by IBM Apache Spark Expert - The use cases for Big Data platform and the benefits of Apache Spark - Why IBM? IBM’s innovations for Apache Spark, hybrid architecture - Open Data Platform (ODP) - IBM’s Analytics Platform for Apache Spark* Lunch*

Real customer use cases and signature business partners

Time:  June 17th 2015, Noon to 2:00pm

Where: Downtown Seattle Restaurant

Contact Kyle Ferraioli - [masked] - Tel:[masked] to RSVP and Confirm your participation for this event and to get details about the restaurant location.

We look forward to having you join us and Sparking your own Innovation as part of something big for data and design!

#SparkInsight
name: IBM | Spark - The start of something big in data and design.

description:
Our June Bluemix meet up will be focused on the Internet of Things (IoT)! IBM and our partners, flowthings.io and Water Hero will present.

Key links:

Bluemix Registration and Getting started information:

www.ibm.biz/cloudboston

IBM IoT developer Zone:

http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/iot/index.html

Gari Singh, IBM Distinguished Engineer

The IBM Internet of Things Foundation service, part of IBM Bluemix, provides capabilities including device registration, connectivity, control, rapid visualization and storage of data derived from the Internet of Things. In this session, Gari will demonstrate the following core capabilities:

- Connect: Easily register and connect devices and apps- Collect: Collect and manage a time series view of data from IoT devices- Assemble: With Bluemix, visually assemble events from IoT into logic flows- Manage: Manage connections and subscriptions with a highly scalable service

Lars Swanson, CFO and Raj Dandage, VP Engineering Services, flowthings.io

flowthings.io empowers any developer or organization to leverage the growing instrumentation of the physical world in order to build IoT solutions that surprise with their intelligence, contextual awareness, and effectiveness in operations and user experiences. In this session, Mike will review and demonstrate the flowthings.io Bluemix Service and discuss how this can help IoT development efforts.

Vic Berry, VP Software Development, Water Hero

Water Hero offers IoT based solutions that protect your home from costly water damage and allow you to control your water system from your smart phone. In this session Vic will review the Water Hero solution, its IoT components and discuss how they are leveraging the BlueMix platform to meet their needs.
name: June Bluemix Meet up : Internet of Things

description:
Historically, building a data warehouse has been a highly complex, and often painstaking, endeavor. You have to decide on specific data warehousing software and then determine and secure the proper balance of hardware and storage to allocate for it. Once you have figured out the physical makeup of the data warehouse, you are then tasked with building both the physical system as well as the logical data models that would support your initiative. This whole process introduces risk each and every time that you change the data warehouse.

Through the nature of cloud computing, you can now gain instant access to critical business insights without the hefty up-front infrastructure investment. With rapid cloud provisioning, you can now load, analyze, and visualize your data in minutes, empowering you with true business agility.

Please join us on Wednesday, June 17, 2015 as we discuss how you can create and maintain a robust, resilient, available, and secure offering for enterprise data warehousing and analytics in the cloud. Don’t let infrastructure stand in the way of realizing immediate value from an agile enterprise data warehouse. Space is limited, so sign up today.
name: Data Warehousing in the Cloud

description:
English Version:

We are planning 3 lectures

1) Technical introduction to Spark. News from Spark Summit (June 15 San-Francisco). IBM and Spark (briefly). Vsevolod Grabelnikov (IBM)

2) Data science using Big Data. Pragmatic approach. Pavel Mesentsev and Dmitry Babaev (Tinkoff Bank)

3) Online learning - Apache Spark alternatives (Vowpal Wabbit). Alexander Krot.

Русская версия:

Коллеги, планируются следующие доклады :

1) Введение в Spark. Новости со Spark Summit (проходит 15 Июня в Сан-Франциско) и очень коротко о стратегии IBM по интеграции своих приложений со Spark. Докладчик: Всеволод Грабельников (IBM)

2) Data science на больших данных. Прагматический подход. Докладчики: Павел Мезенцев и Дмитрий Бабаев (Тинькофф Банк)

3) Онлайн обучение - альтернатива Apache Spark.

В докладе будет рассмотрен подход к обучению линейных функций в задачах Large Scale Machine Learning, когда обучающая выборка поступает на вход потоком. В качестве инструмента будет рассматриваться Vowpal Wabbit. Докладчик: Александр Крот (http://mlclass.ru/, Вымпелком)

N.B. В здании пропускная система, т.е. необходимо подавать список посетителей. Большая просьба прислать организатору (Всеволод Грабельников) свои ФИО не позднее чем за 1 день до мероприятия.

Полезные ссылки:

Курс по основам Spark http://bigdatauniversity.com/bdu-wp/bdu-course/spark-fundamentals/

Сайт IBM посвященный Spark и анализу данных с его помощью

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

Страница проекта в Apache

https://spark.apache.org/

description:
Register here: bit.ly/1EZA0Wh

IMPORTANT! Make sure you also sign-up on the SoftLayer registration page: bit.ly/1EZA0Wh

Registering on the meetup event alone is not enough to guarantee yourself a place.

SoftLayer and Cloudant have co-created a full-day 'Big Data Academy' workshop which they are touring around Europe. The course will focus on using SoftLayer and Cloudant's DBaaS to deploy clusters and solve some big data challenges. General concepts related to NoSQL and distributed datastores (including replication, sharding and performance concerns) will also be covered, making it an excellent introduction for anyone interested in getting up-to-speed in these areas.

It's a BYOD event where the only requirement is that you have Docker installed and it will be taught in English.

Finally, it is recommended that you are at least familiar with the following concepts before joining the course. I don't think that will be much of a problem for most of you. :-)

- Hardware used with cloud computing- Load balancing- Internet and Web-hosting fundamentals- Cloud computing (basics)- HTTP commands (GET, POST, PUT, …)- Representational State Transfer (ReST) API call principles.- Elementary Javascript and Object concepts- Command-line skills using Mac or Linux

Register here: bit.ly/1EZA0Wh

IMPORTANT! Make sure you also sign-up on the SoftLayer registration page: bit.ly/1EZA0Wh

Location: http://www.ahoyberlin.com/en
name: NoSQL workloads in cloud, hands-on workshop

description:
Come estendere il proprio business in ambiente ibrido

La tematica dell’innovazione digitale come motore di crescita è un tema estremamente sentito dalle aziende.Realizzare applicazioni moderne che coinvolgano gli utenti a tutto tondo, sfruttando tecnologie mobile, i social network e che tipicamente debbano gestire dati non strutturati pone nuove sfide in termini di processi di sviluppo, dimensionamento delle infrastrutture e modelli di sostenibilità economica.

Per tutti questi motivi il paradigma di sviluppo software sfrutta sempre di più le tecnologie cloud come approccio abilitante alla scalabilità dei modelli di business.

IBM ha creato la piattaforma Bluemix che mette subito a portata di mano tutti gli strumenti necessari alle applicazioni “cloud native”,

Bluemix è la piattaforma open-standard di IBM di immediata usabilità che offre strumenti, servizi e diversi ambienti di runtime per sviluppare, eseguire e gestire applicazioni in cloud

L'evento prevederà degli approfondimenti su:IBM Bluemix e l'API Management e modelli di integrazione per il cloud ibrido.

Per la registrazione inviare mail a: [masked]
name: Bluemix Meetup

description:
This meetup is intended for people who would like to learn the basics about Big Data technologies. We would like to cover the following:

Short overview of the parallel processing technologies (15 min)

Overview of Hadoop architecture and Hadoop distributions (15 min)

Main tools to work with data in Hadoop. Processing engines : MapReduce, Spark (20 min, short demo)

Short overview of stream processing technologies (20 min, short demo)

Brief talk about advanced analytics in Big Data (15 min)

Overall the presentation should take around 2 hours with the break and questions.

If you are already a hardcore big data developer, this session probably would not be interesting for you. We intend to talk about more advanced stuff in the next sessions.

The meetup will take place in IBM office at Kristalna Palača in BTC, 3rd floor.

Presentation will be in English language.
name: Big Data Essentials

description:
You've heard of HDFS,.. how about GPFS?

GPFS is has been powering the worlds largest supercomputers for more than a decade - for example:

- Leibniz Supercomputing Centre in Munich @ 9500 nodes- National Center for Atmospheric Research (NCAR) @ 4500- Argonne National Laboratory Mira System 49,152 compute nodes

Now this technology is available for Apache Hadoop and we'd like to show you what's under the covers.
name: A closer look at IBM's General Parallel File System (GPFS) for Hadoop

description:
Le développement du «Cloud Computing » établit une plateforme pour le monde de demain. Il propose toute une gamme d'avantages, attirant ainsi les entreprises à offrir leurs produits et plateformes sur le Cloud. Avec cette tendance, des entreprises, en particulier au Senegal, sont nées dans le Cloud. Les startups visiblement font usage du développement en Cloud pour mettre place leurs produits et plateformes dans le Cloud.

Universitaires et Développeurs – « L'avenir est à vous ». Maintenant, le développement de vos idées peut se faire à l'aide d'IBM Bluemix. IBM Bluemix offre une plateforme en tant que service (Platform as a Service ou PaaS) sur le Cloud par laquelle vous pouvez créer une gamme de services dans de multiples technologies en moins de 5 minutes. Pour ceux d'entre vous qui veulent avoir plus d’informations sur « PaaS», visiter http://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plate-forme_en_tant_que_service . IBM Senegal organise, en association avec le CESAG la première édition du Hackathon Bluemix au Senegal à partir du 27 Juin 2015. Une présentation de Bluemix sera faite, puis et sur deux jours de compétition, des équipes seront coachées pour développer des idées en applications en utilisant Bluemix

C’est une grande opportunité pour les étudiants, les professeurs et les développeurs pour savoir plus sur la plateforme IBM Bluemix et bénéficier de cette plateforme pour développer leurs applications futures ou en améliorer d’autres déjà existantes en utilisant les services Bluemix. IBM Bluemix est une plateforme cloud ouverte et destinée à faciliter le développement rapide d'applications dans le cloud. Il comporte plus de 30 services et un modèle de tarification flexible (pay-as-you-go). Le compte de base sur IBM Bluemix est gratuit. Si vous ne possédez pas déjà un compte, vous pouvez tout simplement le créer en allant à https://www.ibm.biz/BluemixMorocco , s’inscrire et vous obtenez alors un accès instantané et gratuit pour un essai de 30 jours. Une carte de crédit n’est pas requise. Comme une étape obligatoire à la compétition du Hackathon, les équipes doivent s’auto-former sur la façon de développer des applications sur Bluemix avant le jour de la compétition et ceci en suivant la formation disponible sur http://www.ibm.biz/moocbluemix .
name: Hackathon IBM CESAG
group_name: Bluemix - Senegal PaaS & Cloud Computing Meetup

description:
6-6:30 PM Keynote: "Data Storage Futures"

How is data storage evolving? Which new media can we expect soon?Will disks still be around in 10 years? Is there a limit to Moore's law?

Dr. Axel Koester, Chief Technologist, IBM EMEA Storage Competence Center Mainz

6:30-6:50 PM Real time video analytics with InfoSphere Streams, OpenCV and R (live demo) and real life experiences with streaming analytics

Unstructured data are a fast growing area and a source for many innovative Big Data & Analytics solutions. Often the first idea of unstructured data seems to be that it's probably text data, even though that is just a small part. A lot of that "new data" is sensor data and especially multimedia (audio, video). Even though this part is growing extremely fast, it is very rarely used in analytics today. And even less in a real time context.

I will demonstrate what does it mean to work with this new data in real time on a live demo and explain important concepts & implementation approaches. The demo shows a drill equipment as it is used to build tunnels and how to analyze the output on the conveyor belt visually with machine learning approaches. Beside this, I will talk about some recent projects in the area of real time analytics where streaming analytics is already used in a big data context.

Stephan Reimann, Senior IT Specialist Information Management, IBM München

6:50 PM -7:15 PM DOCKER: Introduction & Demo, Mirko Stocker, Hochschule Rapperswil, HSR

7:15-7:40 PM Live coding session: And end to end Twitter Evolving topic dashboard using NodeRED, Node.js, Hadoop, BigSQL (Hive), PlayFramework/Scala/Cloudfoundry, JQuery, Romeo Kienzler, IBM

7:40-8:00 PM Distributed Machine Learning: Classification and Regression on a Large Scale, Martin Jaggi, ETH Zurich

8:00 - 8:20 PM Introduction to Bitcoin, Olaf Klein, IBM
name: Cloud & Data Science Connect 2015 - Docker, Spark, Bitcoin, Cloudfoundry & more

description:
Are you an Agent of Change?

By joining the IBM team, you can become a key contributor towards our transformation in developing, marketing, and supporting the next generation of Big Data and Analytics products!

From Software Developers to Hardware Engineers to Product Managers, we have several opportunities available in our Massachusetts locations and across North America. But this is not your typical career fair - join us for a beer, have a slice of pizza (or a few!), make meaningful connections, and explore opportunities to see how IBM is a fit for you.

Hiring managers representing the PureData for Analytics and InfoServer teams will be onsite to engage. Curious about our MA locations? We'll have IBMers from Marlborough and Littleton ready to answer your questions. Interested in other IBM technologies? Our Talent Team will be on hand to provide insight and guidance.

Plus, there will be giveaways! Upon your arrival, be sure to visit the registration booth - complete our brain teaser to enter the raffle for a chance to win a new Apple Watch. All registered attendees will also be entered in the running for free Raspberry Pi giveaways every hour. Speak to our Talent Team for details!

We look forward to meeting you in Boston!

#IBMAnalytics

Please register through Evenbtrite (no registrations will be done through the meet up page for this event only... thank you)
